61class EnumSymbol(object): 

62 """Define a fixed symbol tied to a parent class.""" 

63 

64 def __init__(self, cls_, name, value, description): 

65 """ 

66 Initialize the EnumSymbol. 

67 

68 Args: 

69 cls_ (EnumMeta): The metaclass this symbol is tied to. 

70 name (str): The name of this symbol. 

71 value (str): The value used in the database to represent this symbol. 

72 description (str): A human readable description of this symbol. 

73 """ 

74 self.cls_ = cls_ 

75 self.name = name 

76 self.value = value 

77 self.description = description 

78 

79 def __lt__(self, other): 

80 """ 

81 Return True if self.value is less than other.value. 

82 

83 Args: 

84 other (EnumSymbol): The other EnumSymbol we are being compared to. 

85 Returns: 

86 bool: True if self.value is less than other.value, False otherwise. 

87 """ 

88 return self.value < other.value 

89 

90 def __reduce__(self): 

91 """ 

92 Allow unpickling to return the symbol linked to the DeclEnum class. 

93 

94 Returns: 

95 tuple: A 2-tuple of the ``getattr`` function, and a 2-tuple of the EnumSymbol's member 

96 class and name. 

97 """ 

98 return getattr, (self.cls_, self.name) 

99 

100 def __iter__(self): 

101 """ 

102 Iterate over this EnumSymbol's value and description. 

103 

104 Returns: 

105 iterator: An iterator over the value and description. 

106 """ 

107 return iter([self.value, self.description]) 

108 

109 def __repr__(self): 

110 """ 

111 Return a string representation of this EnumSymbol. 

112 

113 Returns: 

114 str: A string representation of this EnumSymbol's value. 

115 """ 

116 return "<%s>" % self.name 

117 

118 def __str__(self) -> str: 

119 """ 

120 Return a string representation of this EnumSymbol. 

121 

122 Returns: 

123 A string representation of this EnumSymbol's value. 

124 """ 

125 return str(self.value) 

126 

127 def __json__(self, request=None): 

128 """ 

129 Return a JSON representation of this EnumSymbol. 

130 

131 Args: 

132 request (pyramid.request.Request): The current request. 

133 Returns: 

134 str: A string representation of this EnumSymbol's value. 

135 """ 

136 return self.value

139class EnumMeta(type): 

140 """Generate new DeclEnum classes.""" 

141 

142 def __init__(cls, classname, bases, dict_): 

143 """ 

144 Initialize the metaclass. 

145 

146 Args: 

147 classname (str): The name of the enum. 

148 bases (list): A list of base classes for the enum. 

149 dict_ (dict): A key-value mapping for the new enum's attributes. 

150 Returns: 

151 DeclEnum: A new DeclEnum. 

152 """ 

153 cls._reg = reg = cls._reg.copy() 

154 for k, v in dict_.items(): 

155 if isinstance(v, tuple): 

156 sym = reg[v[0]] = EnumSymbol(cls, k, *v) 

157 setattr(cls, k, sym) 

158 return type.__init__(cls, classname, bases, dict_) 

159 

160 def __iter__(cls): 

161 """ 

162 Iterate the enum values. 

163 

164 Returns: 

165 iterator: An iterator for the enum values. 

166 """ 

167 return iter(cls._reg.values())

170class DeclEnum(metaclass=EnumMeta): 

171 """Declarative enumeration.""" 

172 

173 _reg = {} 

174 

175 @classmethod 

176 def from_string(cls, value): 

177 """ 

178 Convert a string version of the enum to its enum type. 

179 

180 Args: 

181 value (str): A string that you wish to convert to an Enum value. 

182 Returns: 

183 EnumSymbol: The symbol corresponding to the value. 

184 Raises: 

185 ValueError: If no symbol matches the given value. 

186 """ 

187 try: 

188 return cls._reg[value] 

189 except KeyError: 

190 raise ValueError("Invalid value for %r: %r" % (cls.__name__, value)) 

191 

192 @classmethod 

193 def values(cls): 

194 """ 

195 Return the possible values that this enum can take on. 

196 

197 Returns: 

198 list: A list of strings of the values that this enum can represent. 

199 """ 

200 return list(cls._reg.keys()) 

201 

202 @classmethod 

203 def db_type(cls): 

204 """ 

205 Return a database column type to be used for this enum. 

206 

207 Returns: 

208 DeclEnumType: A DeclEnumType to be used for this enum. 

209 """ 

210 return DeclEnumType(cls)

213class DeclEnumType(SchemaType, TypeDecorator): 

214 """A database column type for an enum.""" 

215 

216 def __init__(self, enum): 

217 """ 

218 Initialize with the given enum. 

219 

220 Args: 

221 enum (bodhi.server.models.EnumMeta): The enum metaclass. 

222 """ 

223 self.enum = enum 

224 self.impl = Enum( 

225 *enum.values(), 

226 name="ck%s" % re.sub('([A-Z])', lambda m: "_" + m.group(1).lower(), enum.__name__), 

227 # Required for SQLAlchemy >= 1.3.8 

228 # https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/14/changelog/changelog_13.html#change-ac119f6307026142f7a0ccbf81065f25 

229 sort_key_function=lambda e: str(e), 

230 ) 

231 

232 def _set_table(self, table, column): 

233 """ 

234 Set the table for this object. 

235 

236 Args: 

237 table (sqlalchemy.sql.schema.Table): The table that uses this Enum. 

238 column (sqlalchemy.sql.schema.Column): The column that uses this Enum. 

239 """ 

240 self.impl._set_table(table, column) 

241 

242 def copy(self): 

243 """ 

244 Return a copy of self. 

245 

246 Returns: 

247 DeclEnumType: A copy of self. 

248 """ 

249 return DeclEnumType(self.enum) 

250 

251 def process_bind_param(self, value, dialect): 

252 """ 

253 Return the value of the enum. 

254 

255 Args: 

256 value (bodhi.server.models.enum.EnumSymbol): The enum symbol we are resolving the value 

257 of. 

258 dialect (sqlalchemy.engine.default.DefaultDialect): Unused. 

259 Returns: 

260 str: The EnumSymbol's value. 

261 """ 

262 if value is None: 

263 return None 

264 

265 if type(value) is str: 265 ↛ 266line 265 didn't jump to line 266, because the condition on line 265 was never true

266 return value 

267 return value.value 

268 

269 def process_result_value(self, value, dialect): 

270 """ 

271 Return the enum that matches the given string. 

272 

273 Args: 

274 value (str): The name of an enum. 

275 dialect (sqlalchemy.engine.default.DefaultDialect): Unused. 

276 Returns: 

277 EnumSymbol or None: The enum that matches value, or ``None`` if ``value`` is ``None``. 

278 """ 

279 if value is None: 

280 return None 

281 return self.enum.from_string(value.strip())

298class BodhiBase(object): 

299 """ 

300 Base class for the SQLAlchemy model base class. 

301 

302 Attributes: 

303 __exclude_columns__ (tuple): A list of columns to exclude from JSON 

304 __include_extras__ (tuple): A list of methods or attrs to include in JSON 

305 __get_by__ (tuple): A list of columns that :meth:`.get` will query. 

306 id (int): An integer id that serves as the default primary key. 

307 query (sqlalchemy.orm.query.Query): a class property which produces a 

308 Query object against the class and the current Session when called. 

309 """ 

310 

311 __exclude_columns__ = ('id',) 

312 __include_extras__ = tuple() 

313 __get_by__ = () 

314 

315 id = Column(Integer, primary_key=True) 

316 

317 query = Session.query_property() 

318 

319 @classmethod 

320 def get(cls, id): 

321 """ 

322 Return an instance of the model by using its __get_by__ attribute with id. 

323 

324 Args: 

325 id (object): An attribute to look up the model by. 

326 Returns: 

327 BodhiBase or None: An instance of the model that matches the id, or ``None`` if no match 

328 was found. 

329 """ 

330 return cls.query.filter(or_( 

331 getattr(cls, col) == id for col in cls.__get_by__ 

332 )).first() 

333 

334 def __getitem__(self, key): 

335 """ 

336 Define a dictionary like interface for the models. 

337 

338 Args: 

339 key (string): The name of an attribute you wish to retrieve from the model. 

340 Returns: 

341 object: The value of the attribute represented by key. 

342 """ 

343 return getattr(self, key) 

344 

345 def __repr__(self): 

346 """ 

347 Return a string representation of this model. 

348 

349 Returns: 

350 str: A string representation of this model. 

351 """ 

352 return '<{0} {1}>'.format(self.__class__.__name__, self.__json__()) 

353 

354 def __json__(self, request=None, exclude=None, include=None): 

355 """ 

356 Return a JSON representation of this model. 

357 

358 Args: 

359 request (pyramid.request.Request or None): The current web request, or None. 

360 exclude (iterable or None): An iterable of strings naming the attributes to exclude from 

361 the JSON representation of the model. If None (the default), the class's 

362 __exclude_columns__ attribute will be used. 

363 include (iterable or None): An iterable of strings naming the extra attributes to 

364 include in the JSON representation of the model. If None (the default), the class's 

365 __include_extras__ attribute will be used. 

366 Returns: 

367 dict: A dict representation of the model suitable for serialization as JSON. 

368 """ 

369 return self._to_json(self, request=request, exclude=exclude, include=include) 

370 

371 @classmethod 

372 def _to_json(cls, obj, seen=None, request=None, exclude=None, include=None): 

373 """ 

374 Return a JSON representation of obj. 

375 

376 Args: 

377 obj (BodhiBase): The model to serialize. 

378 seen (list or None): A list of attributes we have already serialized. Used by this 

379 method to keep track of its state, as it uses recursion. 

380 request (pyramid.request.Request or None): The current web request, or None. 

381 exclude (iterable or None): An iterable of strings naming the attributes to exclude from 

382 the JSON representation of the model. If None (the default), the class's 

383 __exclude_columns__ attribute will be used. 

384 include (iterable or None): An iterable of strings naming the extra attributes to 

385 include in the JSON representation of the model. If None (the default), the class's 

386 __include_extras__ attribute will be used. 

387 Returns: 

388 dict: A dict representation of the model suitable for serialization. 

389 """ 

390 if not seen: 

391 seen = [] 

392 if not obj: 

393 return 

394 

395 if exclude is None: 

396 exclude = getattr(obj, '__exclude_columns__', []) 

397 properties = list(class_mapper(type(obj)).iterate_properties) 

398 rels = [p.key for p in properties if isinstance(p, RelationshipProperty)] 

399 attrs = [p.key for p in properties if p.key not in rels] 

400 d = dict([(attr, getattr(obj, attr)) for attr in attrs 

401 if attr not in exclude and not attr.startswith('_')]) 

402 

403 if include is None: 

404 include = getattr(obj, '__include_extras__', []) 

405 

406 for name in include: 

407 attribute = getattr(obj, name) 

408 if callable(attribute): 

409 attribute = attribute(request) 

410 d[name] = attribute 

411 

412 for attr in rels: 

413 if attr in exclude: 

414 continue 

415 target = getattr(type(obj), attr).property.mapper.class_ 

416 if target in seen: 

417 continue 

418 d[attr] = cls._expand(obj, getattr(obj, attr), seen, request) 

419 

420 for key, value in d.items(): 

421 

422 if isinstance(value, datetime): 

423 d[key] = value.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S') 

424 elif isinstance(value, date): 

425 d[key] = value.isoformat() 

426 if isinstance(value, EnumSymbol): 

427 d[key] = str(value) 

428 

429 return d 

430 

431 @classmethod 

432 def _expand(cls, obj, relation, seen, req): 

433 """ 

434 Return the to_json or id of a sqlalchemy relationship. 

435 

436 Args: 

437 obj (BodhiBase): The object we are trying to describe a relationship on. 

438 relation (object): A relationship attribute on obj we are trying to learn about. 

439 seen (list): A list of objects we have already recursed over. 

440 req (pyramid.request.Request): The current request. 

441 Returns: 

442 object: The to_json() or the id of a sqlalchemy relationship. 

443 """ 

444 if hasattr(relation, 'all'): 

445 relation = relation.all() 

446 if hasattr(relation, '__iter__'): 

447 return [cls._expand(obj, item, seen, req) for item in relation] 

448 if type(relation) not in seen: 

449 return cls._to_json(relation, seen + [type(obj)], req) 

450 else: 

451 return relation.id 

452 

453 @classmethod 

454 def grid_columns(cls): 

455 """ 

456 Return the column names for the model, except for the excluded ones. 

457 

458 Returns: 

459 list: A list of column names, with excluded ones removed. 

460 """ 

461 columns = [] 

462 exclude = getattr(cls, '__exclude_columns__', []) 

463 for col in cls.__table__.columns: 

464 if col.name in exclude: 

465 continue 

466 columns.append(col.name) 

467 return columns 

468 

469 @classmethod 

470 def find_polymorphic_child(cls, identity): 

471 """ 

472 Find a child of a polymorphic base class. 

473 

474 For example, given the base Package class and the 'rpm' identity, this 

475 class method should return the RpmPackage class. 

476 

477 This is accomplished by iterating over all classes in scope. 

478 Limiting that to only those which are an extension of the given base 

479 class. Among those, return the one whose polymorphic_identity matches 

480 the value given. If none are found, then raise a NameError. 

481 

482 Args: 

483 identity (EnumSymbol): An instance of EnumSymbol used to identify the child. 

484 Returns: 

485 BodhiBase: The type-specific child class. 

486 Raises: 

487 KeyError: If this class is not polymorphic. 

488 NameError: If no child class is found for the given identity. 

489 TypeError: If identity is not an EnumSymbol. 

490 """ 

491 if not isinstance(identity, EnumSymbol): 

492 raise TypeError("%r is not an instance of EnumSymbol" % identity) 

493 

494 if 'polymorphic_on' not in getattr(cls, '__mapper_args__', {}): 

495 raise KeyError("%r is not a polymorphic model." % cls) 

496 

497 classes = (c for c in globals().values() if isinstance(c, type)) 

498 children = (c for c in classes if issubclass(c, cls)) 

499 for child in children: 

500 candidate = child.__mapper_args__.get('polymorphic_identity') 

501 if candidate is identity: 

502 return child 

503 

504 error = "Found no child of %r with identity %r" 

505 raise NameError(error % (cls, identity))

509metadata = Base.metadata

515class ContentType(DeclEnum): 

516 """ 

517 Used to differentiate between different kinds of content in various models. 

518 

519 This enum is used to mark objects as pertaining to particular kinds of content type, such as 

520 RPMs or Modules. 

521 

522 Attributes: 

523 base (EnumSymbol): This is used to represent base classes that are shared between specific 

524 content types. 

525 rpm (EnumSymbol): Used to represent RPM related objects. 

526 module (EnumSymbol): Used to represent Module related objects. 

527 container (EnumSymbol): Used to represent Container related objects. 

528 flatpak (EnumSymbol): Used to represent Flatpak related objects. 

529 """ 

530 

531 base = 'base', 'Base' 

532 rpm = 'rpm', 'RPM' 

533 module = 'module', 'Module' 

534 container = 'container', 'Container' 

535 flatpak = 'flatpak', 'Flatpak' 

536 

537 @classmethod 

538 def infer_content_class(cls, base, build): 

539 """ 

540 Identify and return the child class associated with the appropriate ContentType. 

541 

542 For example, given the Package base class and a normal koji build, return 

543 the RpmPackage model class. Or, given the Build base class and a container 

544 build, return the ContainerBuild model class. 

545 

546 Args: 

547 base (BodhiBase): A base model class, such as :class:`Build` or :class:`Package`. 

548 build (dict): Information about the build from the build system (koji). 

549 Returns: 

550 BodhiBase: The type-specific child class of base that is appropriate to use with the 

551 given koji build. 

552 """ 

553 # Default value. Overridden below if we find markers in the build info 

554 identity = cls.rpm 

555 

556 extra = build.get('extra') or {} 

557 if 'module' in extra.get('typeinfo', {}): 

558 identity = cls.module 

559 elif 'container_koji_task_id' in extra: 

560 if 'flatpak' in extra['image']: 

561 identity = cls.flatpak 

562 else: 

563 identity = cls.container 

564 

565 return base.find_polymorphic_child(identity)

568class UpdateStatus(DeclEnum): 

569 """ 

570 An enum used to describe the current state of an update. 

571 

572 Attributes: 

573 pending (EnumSymbol): The update is not in any repository. 

574 testing (EnumSymbol): The update is in the testing repository. 

575 stable (EnumSymbol): The update is in the stable repository. 

576 unpushed (EnumSymbol): The update had been in a testing repository, but has been removed. 

577 obsolete (EnumSymbol): The update has been obsoleted by another update. 

578 side_tag_active (EnumSymbol): The update's side tag is currently active.

685class ReleaseState(DeclEnum):

690 disabled (EnumSymbol): Indicates that the release is disabled. 

691 pending (EnumSymbol): Indicates that the release is pending. 

692 frozen (EnumSymbol): Indicates that the release is frozen. 

693 current (EnumSymbol): Indicates that the release is current. 

694 archived (EnumSymbol): Indicates that the release is archived. 

695 """ 

696 

697 disabled = 'disabled', 'disabled' 

698 pending = 'pending', 'pending' 

699 frozen = 'frozen', 'frozen' 

700 current = 'current', 'current' 

701 archived = 'archived', 'archived'

704class ComposeState(DeclEnum): 

705 """ 

706 Define the various states that a :class:`Compose` can be in. 

707 

708 Attributes: 

709 requested (EnumSymbol): A compose has been requested, but it has not started yet. 

710 pending (EnumSymbol): The request for the compose has been received by the backend worker, 

711 but the compose has not started yet. 

712 initializing (EnumSymbol): The compose is initializing. 

713 updateinfo (EnumSymbol): The updateinfo.xml is being generated. 

714 punging (EnumSymbol): A Pungi soldier has been deployed to deal with the situation. 

715 syncing_repo (EnumSymbol): The repo is being synced to the master mirror. 

716 notifying (EnumSymbol): Pungi has finished successfully, and we are now sending out various 

717 forms of notifications, such as e-mail, bus messages, and bugzilla. 

718 success (EnumSymbol): The Compose has completed successfully. 

719 failed (EnumSymbol): The compose has failed, abandon hope. 

720 signing_repo (EnumSymbol): Waiting for the repo to be signed. 

721 cleaning (EnumSymbol): Cleaning old Composes after successful completion. 

722 """ 

723 

724 requested = 'requested', 'Requested' 

725 pending = 'pending', 'Pending' 

726 initializing = 'initializing', 'Initializing' 

727 updateinfo = 'updateinfo', 'Generating updateinfo.xml' 

728 punging = 'punging', 'Waiting for Pungi to finish' 

729 syncing_repo = 'syncing_repo', 'Wait for the repo to hit the master mirror' 

730 notifying = 'notifying', 'Sending notifications' 

731 success = 'success', 'Success' 

732 failed = 'failed', 'Failed' 

733 signing_repo = 'signing_repo', 'Signing repo' 

734 cleaning = 'cleaning', 'Cleaning old composes'

768class Release(Base): 

769 """ 

770 Represent a distribution release, such as Fedora 27. 

771 

772 Attributes: 

773 name (str): The name of the release, such as 'F27'. 

774 long_name (str): A human readable name for the release, such as 'Fedora 27'. 

775 version (str): The version of the release, such as '27'. 

776 id_prefix (str): The prefix to use when forming update aliases for this release, such as 

777 'FEDORA'. 

778 branch (str): The dist-git branch associated with this release, such as 'f27'. 

779 dist_tag (str): The koji dist_tag associated with this release, such as 'f27'. 

780 stable_tag (str): The koji tag to be used for stable builds in this release, such as 

781 'f27-updates'. 

782 testing_tag (str): The koji tag to be used for testing builds in this release, such as 

783 'f27-updates-testing'. 

784 candidate_tag (str): The koji tag used for builds that are candidates to be updates, 

785 such as 'f27-updates-candidate'. 

786 pending_signing_tag (str): The koji tag that specifies that a build is waiting to be 

787 signed, such as 'f27-signing-pending'. 

788 pending_testing_tag (str): The koji tag that indicates that a build is waiting to be 

789 composed into the testing repository, such as 'f27-updates-testing-pending'. 

790 pending_stable_tag (str): The koji tag that indicates that a build is waiting to be 

791 composed into the stable repository, such as 'f27-updates-pending'. 

792 override_tag (str): The koji tag that is used when a build is added as a buildroot 

793 override, such as 'f27-override'. 

794 mail_template (str): The notification mail template. 

795 state (:class:`ReleaseState`): The current state of the release. Defaults to 

796 ``ReleaseState.disabled``. 

797 id (int): The primary key of this release. 

798 builds (sqlalchemy.orm.collections.InstrumentedList): An iterable of :class:`Builds <Build>` 

799 associated with this release. 

800 composed_by_bodhi (bool): The flag that indicates whether the release is composed by 

801 Bodhi or not. Defaults to True. 

802 create_automatic_updates (bool): A flag indicating that updates should 

803 be created automatically for Koji builds tagged into the 

804 `candidate_tag`. Defaults to False. 

805 package_manager (EnumSymbol): The package manager this release uses. This must be one of 

806 the values defined in :class:`PackageManager`. 

807 testing_repository (str): The name of repository where updates are placed for 

808 testing before being pushed to the main repository. 

809 eol (str): End-of-life of the release in a datetime.date() format '2020-05-17'. 

810 """ 

811 

812 __tablename__ = 'releases' 

813 __exclude_columns__ = ('id', 'builds') 

814 __get_by__ = ('name', 'long_name', 'dist_tag') 

815 

816 name = Column(Unicode(10), unique=True, nullable=False) 

817 long_name = Column(Unicode(25), unique=True, nullable=False) 

818 version = Column(Unicode(5), nullable=False) 

819 id_prefix = Column(Unicode(25), nullable=False) 

820 branch = Column(Unicode(10), nullable=False) 

821 

822 dist_tag = Column(Unicode(20), nullable=False) 

823 stable_tag = Column(UnicodeText, nullable=False) 

824 testing_tag = Column(UnicodeText, nullable=False) 

825 candidate_tag = Column(UnicodeText, nullable=False) 

826 pending_signing_tag = Column(UnicodeText, nullable=False) 

827 pending_testing_tag = Column(UnicodeText, nullable=False) 

828 pending_stable_tag = Column(UnicodeText, nullable=False) 

829 override_tag = Column(UnicodeText, nullable=False) 

830 mail_template = Column(UnicodeText, default='fedora_errata_template', nullable=False) 

831 

832 state = Column(ReleaseState.db_type(), default=ReleaseState.disabled, nullable=False) 

833 composed_by_bodhi = Column(Boolean, default=True) 

834 create_automatic_updates = Column(Boolean, default=False) 

835 

836 _version_int_regex = re.compile(r'\D+(\d+)[CMFN]?$') 

837 

838 package_manager = Column(PackageManager.db_type(), default=PackageManager.unspecified) 

839 testing_repository = Column(UnicodeText, nullable=True) 

840 eol = Column(Date, nullable=True)

924 @classmethod

926 """

930 defaultdict: Mapping strings of :class:`ReleaseState` names to lists of dictionaries 

931 that describe the releases in those states.

933 if cls._all_releases: 

934 return cls._all_releases 

935 releases = defaultdict(list) 

936 for release in cls.query.order_by(cls.name.desc()).all(): 

937 releases[release.state.value].append(release.__json__())

947 @classmethod 

948 def get_tags(cls, session): 

949 """ 

950 Return a 2-tuple mapping tags to releases. 

951 

952 Args: 

953 session (sqlalchemy.orm.session.Session): A database session. 

954 Returns: 

955 tuple: A 2-tuple. The first element maps the keys 'candidate', 'testing', 'stable', 

956 'override', 'pending_testing', and 'pending_stable' each to a list of tags for various 

957 releases that correspond to those tag semantics. The second element maps each koji tag 

958 to the release's name that uses it. 

959 """ 

960 if cls._tag_cache: 

961 return cls._tag_cache 

962 data = {'candidate': [], 'testing': [], 'stable': [], 'override': [], 

963 'pending_testing': [], 'pending_stable': []} 

964 tags = {} # tag -> release lookup 

965 for release in session.query(cls).all(): 

966 for key in data: 

967 tag = getattr(release, '%s_tag' % key) 

968 data[key].append(tag) 

969 tags[tag] = release.name 

970 cls._tag_cache = (data, tags) 

971 return cls._tag_cache 

972 _tag_cache = None 

973 

974 @classmethod 

975 def from_tags(cls, tags, session): 

976 """ 

977 Find a release associated with one of the given koji tags. 

978 

979 Args: 

980 tags (list): A list of koji tags for which an associated release is desired. 

981 session (sqlalchemy.orm.session.Session): A database session. 

982 Returns: 

983 Release or None: The first release found that matches the first tag. If no release is 

984 found, ``None`` is returned. 

985 """ 

986 tag_types, tag_rels = cls.get_tags(session) 

987 for tag in tags: 

988 if tag not in tag_rels: 

989 continue 

990 release = session.query(cls).filter_by(name=tag_rels[tag]).first() 

991 if release: 991 ↛ 987line 991 didn't jump to line 987, because the condition on line 991 was never false

992 return release

1070class Package(Base): 

1071 """ 

1072 This model represents a package. 

1073 

1074 This model uses single-table inheritance to allow for different package types. 

1075 

1076 Attributes: 

1077 name (str): A text string that uniquely identifies the package. 

1078 requirements (str): A text string that lists space-separated taskotron test 

1079 results that must pass for this package 

1080 type (int): The polymorphic identity column. This is used to identify what Python 

1081 class to create when loading rows from the database. 

1082 builds (sqlalchemy.orm.collections.InstrumentedList): A list of :class:`Build` objects. 

1083 """ 

1084 

1085 __tablename__ = 'packages' 

1086 __get_by__ = ('name',) 

1087 __exclude_columns__ = ('id', 'builds',) 

1088 

1089 name = Column(UnicodeText, nullable=False) 

1090 requirements = Column(UnicodeText) 

1091 type = Column(ContentType.db_type(), nullable=False) 

1092 

1093 # One-to-many relationships 

1094 builds = relationship('Build', backref=backref('package', lazy='joined', innerjoin=True)) 

1095 

1096 __mapper_args__ = { 

1097 'polymorphic_on': type, 

1098 'polymorphic_identity': ContentType.base, 

1099 } 

1100 

1101 __table_args__ = ( 

1102 UniqueConstraint('name', 'type', name='packages_name_and_type_key'), 

1103 )

1105 @property

1107 """ 

1108 Return the package name as it's known to external services. 

1109 

1110 For most Packages, this is self.name. 

1111 

1112 Returns: 

1113 str: The name of this package.

1116 

1117 def get_pkg_committers_from_pagure(self): 

1118 """ 

1119 Pull users and groups who can commit on a package in Pagure. 

1120 

1121 Returns a tuple with two lists: 

1122 * The first list contains usernames that have commit access. 

1123 * The second list contains FAS group names that have commit access. 

1124 

1125 Raises: 

1126 RuntimeError: If Pagure did not give us a 200 code. 

1127 """ 

1128 pagure_url = config.get('pagure_url') 

1129 namespace = config.get('pagure_namespaces')[self.type.name] 

1130 package_pagure_url = '{0}/api/0/{1}/{2}?expand_group=1'.format( 

1131 pagure_url.rstrip('/'), namespace, self.external_name) 

1132 package_json = pagure_api_get(package_pagure_url) 

1133 

1134 committers = set() 

1135 for access_type in ['owner', 'admin', 'commit']: 

1136 committers = committers | set( 

1137 package_json['access_users'][access_type]) 

1138 

1139 groups = set() 

1140 for access_type in ['admin', 'commit']: 

1141 for group_name in package_json['access_groups'][access_type]: 

1142 groups.add(group_name) 

1143 # Add to the list of committers the users in the groups 

1144 # having admin or commit access 

1145 committers = committers | set( 

1146 package_json.get( 

1147 'group_details', {}).get(group_name, [])) 

1148 

1149 # The first list contains usernames with commit access. The second list 

1150 # contains FAS group names with commit access. 

1151 return list(committers), list(groups) 

1152 

1153 def hascommitaccess(self, username: str, branchname: str) -> bool: 

1154 """ 

1155 Check on Pagure if a user has commit access on the package/branch. 

1156 

1157 Raises: 

1158 RuntimeError: If Pagure did not give us a 200 code. 

1159 """ 

1160 pagure_url = config.get('pagure_url') 

1161 namespace = config.get('pagure_namespaces')[self.type.name] 

1162 # Here we override the queried branchname because: 

1163 # - flatpaks only have one main branch 

1164 # - modules streams have no direct mapping to branch names 

1165 # The effect is that we cannot check collaborators rights for specific 

1166 # streams on modules, so we fall back to old Bodhi behavior 

1167 if self.type == ContentType.flatpak: 

1168 branchname = config.get('pagure_flatpak_main_branch') 

1169 elif self.type == ContentType.module: 

1170 branchname = config.get('pagure_module_main_branch') 

1171 

1172 pagure_query_url = (f'{pagure_url.rstrip("/")}/api/0/{namespace}/{self.external_name}' 

1173 f'/hascommit?user={username}&branch={branchname}') 

1174 pagure_response = pagure_api_get(pagure_query_url) 

1175 return pagure_response['hascommit'] 

1176 

1177 @validates('builds') 

1178 def validate_builds(self, key, build): 

1179 """ 

1180 Validate builds being appended to ensure they are all the same type as the Package. 

1181 

1182 This method checks to make sure that all the builds on self.builds have their type attribute 

1183 equal to self.type. The goal is to make sure that Builds of a specific type are only ever 

1184 associated with Packages of the same type and vice-versa. For example, RpmBuilds should only 

1185 ever associate with RpmPackages and never with ModulePackages. 

1186 

1187 Args: 

1188 key (str): The field's key, which is un-used in this validator. 

1189 build (Build): The build object which was appended to the list 

1190 of builds. 

1191 

1192 Raises: 

1193 ValueError: If the build being appended is not the same type as the package. 

1194 """ 

1195 if build.type != self.type: 

1196 raise ValueError( 

1197 ("A {} Build cannot be associated with a {} Package. A Package's builds must be " 

1198 "the same type as the package.").format( 

1199 build.type.description, self.type.description)) 

1200 return build 

1201 

1202 def __str__(self): 

1203 """ 

1204 Return a string representation of the package. 

1205 

1206 Returns: 

1207 str: A string representing this package. 

1208 """ 

1209 x = header(self.name) 

1210 states = {'pending': [], 'testing': [], 'stable': []} 

1211 if self.builds: 1211 ↛ 1216line 1211 didn't jump to line 1216, because the condition on line 1211 was never false

1212 for build in self.builds: 

1213 if build.update and build.update.status.description in states: 1213 ↛ 1212line 1213 didn't jump to line 1212, because the condition on line 1213 was never false

1214 states[build.update.status.description].append( 

1215 build.update) 

1216 for state in states: 

1217 if states[state]: 

1218 x += "\n %s Updates (%d)\n" % (state.title(), 

1219 len(states[state])) 

1220 for update in states[state]: 

1221 x += " o %s\n" % update.get_title() 

1222 del states 

1223 return x

1225 @staticmethod 

1226 def _get_name(build): 

1227 """ 

1228 Determine the package name for a particular build. 

1229 

1230 For most builds, this will return the RPM name, unless overridden in a specific 

1231 subclass. 

1232 

1233 Args: 

1234 build (dict): Information about the build from the build system (koji). 

1235 Returns: 

1236 str: The Package object identifier for this build. 

1237 """ 

1238 name, _, _ = build['nvr'] 

1239 return name 

1240 

1241 @staticmethod 

1242 def get_or_create(session, build): 

1243 """ 

1244 Identify and return the Package instance associated with the build. 

1245 

1246 For example, given a normal koji build, return a RpmPackage instance. 

1247 Or, given a container, return a ContainerBuild instance. 

1248 

1249 Args: 

1250 session (sqlalchemy.orm.session.Session): A database session. 

1251 build (dict): Information about the build from the build system (koji). 

1252 Returns: 

1253 Package: A type-specific instance of Package for the specific build requested. 

1254 """ 

1255 base = ContentType.infer_content_class(Package, build['info']) 

1256 name = base._get_name(build) 

1257 package = base.query.filter_by(name=name).one_or_none() 

1258 if not package: 

1259 package = base(name=name) 

1260 session.add(package) 

1261 session.flush() 

1262 return package

1300 @staticmethod

1309 """ 

1310 name, stream, _ = build['nvr'] 

1311 return '%s:%s' % (name, stream)

1322class Build(Base): 

1323 """ 

1324 This model represents a specific build of a package. 

1325 

1326 This model uses single-table inheritance to allow for different build types. 

1327 

1328 Attributes: 

1329 nvr (str): The nvr field is really a mapping to the Koji build_target.name field, and is 

1330 used to reference builds in Koji. It is named nvr in reference to the dash-separated 

1331 name-version-release Koji name for RPMs, but it is used by other types as well. At the 

1332 time of this writing, it was not practical to rename nvr since it is used in the REST 

1333 API to reference builds. Thus, it should be thought of as a Koji build identifier rather 

1334 than strictly as an RPM's name, version, and release. 

1335 package_id (int): A foreign key to the Package that this Build is part of. 

1336 release_id (int): A foreign key to the Release that this Build is part of. 

1337 signed (bool): If True, this package has been signed by robosignatory. If False, it has not 

1338 been signed yet. 

1339 update_id (int): A foreign key to the Update that this Build is part of. 

1340 release (sqlalchemy.orm.relationship): A relationship to the Release that this build is part 

1341 of. 

1342 type (ContentType): The polymorphic identify of the row. This is used by sqlalchemy to 

1343 identify which subclass of Build to use. 

1344 testcases (sqlalchemy.orm.collections.InstrumentedList): A list of :class:`TestCase` 

1345 objects. 

1346 """ 

1347 

1348 __tablename__ = 'builds' 

1349 __exclude_columns__ = ('id', 'package', 'package_id', 'release', 'testcases', 

1350 'update_id', 'update', 'override') 

1351 __get_by__ = ('nvr',) 

1352 

1353 nvr = Column(Unicode(100), unique=True, nullable=False) 

1354 signed = Column(Boolean, default=False, nullable=False) 

1355 

1356 # Many-to-one relationships 

1357 package_id = Column(Integer, ForeignKey('packages.id'), nullable=False) 

1358 # package backref from Package 

1359 release_id = Column(Integer, ForeignKey('releases.id')) 

1360 release = relationship('Release', backref='builds', lazy=False) 

1361 update_id = Column(Integer, ForeignKey('updates.id'), index=True) 

1362 # update backref from Update 

1363 

1364 # Many-to-many relationships 

1365 testcases = relationship('TestCase', secondary=build_testcase_table, 

1366 backref='builds', order_by='TestCase.name') 

1367 

1368 type = Column(ContentType.db_type(), nullable=False) 

1369 __mapper_args__ = { 

1370 'polymorphic_on': type, 

1371 'polymorphic_identity': ContentType.base, 

1372 }

1484 

1485 def unpush(self, koji): 

1486 """ 

1487 Move this build back to the candidate tag and remove any pending tags. 

1488 

1489 Args: 

1490 koji (bodhi.server.buildsys.Buildsysem or koji.ClientSession): A koji client. 

1491 """ 

1492 log.info('Unpushing %s' % self.nvr) 

1493 release = self.update.release 

1494 for tag in self.get_tags(koji): 

1495 if tag == release.pending_signing_tag: 

1496 log.info('Removing %s tag from %s' % (tag, self.nvr)) 

1497 koji.untagBuild(tag, self.nvr) 

1498 if tag == release.pending_testing_tag: 

1499 log.info('Removing %s tag from %s' % (tag, self.nvr)) 

1500 koji.untagBuild(tag, self.nvr) 

1501 if tag == release.pending_stable_tag: 

1502 log.info('Removing %s tag from %s' % (tag, self.nvr)) 

1503 koji.untagBuild(tag, self.nvr) 

1504 elif tag == release.testing_tag: 

1505 log.info( 

1506 'Moving %s from %s to %s' % ( 

1507 self.nvr, tag, release.candidate_tag)) 

1508 koji.moveBuild(tag, release.candidate_tag, self.nvr) 

1509 

1510 def is_latest(self) -> bool: 

1511 """Check if this is the latest build available in the stable tag.""" 

1512 koji_session = buildsys.get_session() 

1513 # Get the latest builds in koji in a tag for a package 

1514 koji_builds = koji_session.getLatestBuilds( 

1515 self.update.release.stable_tag, 

1516 package=self.package.name 

1517 ) 

1518 

1519 for koji_build in koji_builds: 

1520 build_creation_time = datetime.fromisoformat(koji_build['creation_time']) 

1521 if self.get_creation_time() < build_creation_time: 

1522 return False 

1523 return True

1525 def update_test_cases(self, db): 

1526 """ 

1527 Update the list of test cases for this build from the wiki. 

1528 

1529 Args: 

1530 db (sqlalchemy.orm.session.Session): A database session. 

1531 Raises: 

1532 ExternalCallException: When retrieving testcases from Wiki failed. 

1533 """ 

1534 if not config.get('query_wiki_test_cases'): 1534 ↛ 1535line 1534 didn't jump to line 1535, because the condition on line 1534 was never true

1535 return 

1536 

1537 start = datetime.utcnow() 

1538 log.debug(f'Querying the wiki for test cases of {self.nvr}') 

1539 

1540 wiki = MediaWiki(config.get('wiki_url')) 

1541 cat_page = f'Category:Package {self.package.external_name} test cases' 

1542 

1543 def list_categorymembers(wiki, cat_page, limit=500): 

1544 # Build query arguments and call wiki 

1545 query = dict(action='query', list='categorymembers', 

1546 cmtitle=cat_page, cmlimit=limit) 

1547 try: 

1548 response = wiki.call(query) 

1549 except URLError: 

1550 raise ExternalCallException('Failed retrieving testcases from Wiki') 

1551 members = [entry['title'] for entry in 

1552 response.get('query', {}).get('categorymembers', {}) 

1553 if 'title' in entry] 

1554 

1555 # Determine whether we need to recurse 

1556 if limit > 0: 1556 ↛ 1562line 1556 didn't jump to line 1562, because the condition on line 1556 was never false

1557 for idx, member in enumerate(copy(members)): 

1558 if member.startswith('Category:'): 

1559 members.extend(list_categorymembers(wiki, member, limit - 1)) 

1560 members.remove(members[idx]) # remove Category from list 

1561 

1562 log.debug(f'Found the following unit tests: {members}') 

1563 return members 

1564 

1565 fetched = set(list_categorymembers(wiki, cat_page)) 

1566 

1567 # Delete removed testcases 

1568 for case in self.testcases: 

1569 if case.name not in fetched: 

1570 self.testcases.remove(case) 

1571 log.debug(f'Removed testcase "{case.name}" from {self.nvr}') 

1572 

1573 # Add new testcases 

1574 for test in fetched: 

1575 case = TestCase.get(test) 

1576 if not case: 

1577 case = TestCase(name=test) 

1578 db.add(case) 

1579 db.flush() 

1580 log.debug(f'Found new testcase "{case.name}" and added to database') 

1581 if case not in self.testcases: 

1582 self.testcases.append(case) 

1583 log.debug(f'Added testcase "{case.name}" to {self.nvr}') 

1584 

1585 db.flush() 

1586 log.debug(f'Finished querying for test cases in {datetime.utcnow() - start}')

1658class RpmBuild(Build): 

1659 """ 

1660 Represents an RPM build. 

1661 

1662 Note that this model uses single-table inheritance with its Build superclass. 

1663 

1664 Attributes: 

1665 nvr (str): A dash (-) separated string of an RPM's name, version, and release (e.g. 

1666 'bodhi-2.5.0-1.fc26') 

1667 epoch (int): The RPM's epoch. 

1668 """ 

1669 

1670 epoch = Column(Integer, default=0) 

1671 

1672 __mapper_args__ = { 

1673 'polymorphic_identity': ContentType.rpm, 

1674 } 

1675 

1676 @property 

1677 def evr(self): 

1678 """ 

1679 Return the RpmBuild's epoch, version, release, all strings in a 3-tuple. 

1680 

1681 Return: 

1682 tuple: (epoch, version, release) 

1683 """ 

1684 if not self.epoch: 

1685 self.epoch = self._get_kojiinfo()['epoch'] 

1686 if not self.epoch: 1686 ↛ 1688line 1686 didn't jump to line 1688, because the condition on line 1686 was never false

1687 self.epoch = 0 

1688 return (str(self.epoch), str(self.nvr_version), str(self.nvr_release)) 

1689 

1690 def get_latest(self): 

1691 """ 

1692 Return the nvr string of the most recent evr that is less than this RpmBuild's nvr. 

1693 

1694 If there is no other Build, this returns ``None``. 

1695 

1696 Returns: 

1697 str or None: An nvr string, formatted like RpmBuild.nvr. If there is no other 

1698 Build, returns ``None``. 

1699 """ 

1700 koji_session = buildsys.get_session() 

1701 

1702 # Grab a list of builds tagged with ``Release.stable_tag`` release 

1703 # tags, and find the most recent update for this package, other than 

1704 # this one. If nothing is tagged for -updates, then grab the first 

1705 # thing in ``Release.dist_tag``. We aren't checking 

1706 # ``Release.candidate_tag`` first, because there could potentially be 

1707 # packages that never make their way over stable, so we don't want to 

1708 # generate ChangeLogs against those. 

1709 latest = None 

1710 evr = self.evr 

1711 for tag in [self.release.stable_tag, self.release.dist_tag]: 

1712 builds = koji_session.listTagged( 

1713 tag, package=self.package.name, inherit=True) 

1714 

1715 # Find the first build that is older than us 

1716 for build in builds: 1716 ↛ 1717line 1716 didn't jump to line 1717, because the loop on line 1716 never started

1717 old_evr = build_evr(build) 

1718 if rpm.labelCompare(evr, old_evr) > 0: 

1719 latest = build['nvr'] 

1720 break 

1721 if latest: 1721 ↛ 1722line 1721 didn't jump to line 1722, because the condition on line 1721 was never true

1722 break 

1723 return latest

1725 def get_changelog(self, timelimit=0, lastupdate=False): 

1726 """ 

1727 Retrieve the RPM changelog of this package since it's last update, or since timelimit. 

1728 

1729 Args: 

1730 timelimit (int): Timestamp, specified as the number of seconds since 1970-01-01 00:00:00 

1731 UTC. 

1732 lastupdate (bool): Only returns changelog since last update. 

1733 Return: 

1734 str: The RpmBuild's changelog. 

1735 """ 

1736 rpm_header = get_rpm_header(self.nvr) 

1737 descrip = rpm_header['changelogtext'] 

1738 if not descrip: 

1739 return "" 

1740 

1741 who = rpm_header['changelogname'] 

1742 when = rpm_header['changelogtime'] 

1743 

1744 num = len(descrip) 

1745 if not isinstance(when, list): 

1746 when = [when] 

1747 

1748 if lastupdate: 

1749 lastpkg = self.get_latest() 

1750 if lastpkg is not None: 

1751 oldh = get_rpm_header(lastpkg) 

1752 if oldh['changelogtext']: 

1753 timelimit = oldh['changelogtime'] 

1754 if isinstance(timelimit, list): 1754 ↛ 1757line 1754 didn't jump to line 1757, because the condition on line 1754 was never false

1755 timelimit = timelimit[0] 

1756 

1757 str = "" 

1758 i = 0 

1759 while (i < num) and (when[i] > timelimit): 

1760 try: 

1761 str += '* %s %s\n%s\n' % (time.strftime("%a %b %e %Y", 

1762 time.localtime(when[i])), who[i], 

1763 descrip[i]) 

1764 except Exception: 

1765 log.exception('Unable to add changelog entry for header %s', 

1766 rpm_header) 

1767 i += 1 

1768 return str

1771class Update(Base): 

1772 """ 

1773 This model represents an update. 

1774 

1775 The update contains not just one package, but a collection of packages. Each 

1776 package can be referenced only once in one Update. Packages are referenced 

1777 through their Build objects using field `builds` below. 

1778 

1779 Attributes: 

1780 autokarma (bool): A boolean that indicates whether or not the update will 

1781 be automatically pushed when the stable_karma threshold is reached. 

1782 autotime (bool): A boolean that indicates whether or not the update will 

1783 be automatically pushed when the time threshold is reached. 

1784 stable_karma (int): A positive integer that indicates the amount of "good" 

1785 karma the update must receive before being automatically marked as stable. 

1786 stable_days (int): A positive integer that indicates the number of days an update 

1787 needs to spend in testing before being automatically marked as stable. 

1788 unstable_karma (int): A positive integer that indicates the amount of "bad" 

1789 karma the update must receive before being automatically marked as unstable. 

1790 requirements (str): A list of taskotron tests that must pass for this 

1791 update to be considered stable. 

1792 require_bugs (bool): Indicates whether or not positive feedback needs to be 

1793 provided for the associated bugs before the update can be considered 

1794 stable. 

1795 require_testcases (bool): Indicates whether or not the update requires that 

1796 positive feedback be given on all associated wiki test cases before the 

1797 update can pass to stable. If the update has no associated wiki test cases, 

1798 this option has no effect. 

1799 display_name (str): Allows the user to customize the name of the update. 

1800 notes (str): Notes about the update. This is a human-readable field that 

1801 describes what the update is for (e.g. the bugs it fixes). 

1802 type (EnumSymbol): The type of the update (e.g. enhancement, bugfix, etc). It 

1803 must be one of the values defined in :class:`UpdateType`. 

1804 status (EnumSymbol): The current status of the update. Possible values include 

1805 'pending' to indicate it is not yet in a repository, 'testing' to indicate it 

1806 is in the testing repository, etc. It must be one of the values defined in 

1807 :class:`UpdateStatus`. 

1808 request (EnumSymbol): The requested status of the update. This must be one of the 

1809 values defined in :class:`UpdateRequest` or ``None``. 

1810 severity (EnumSymbol): The update's severity. This must be one of the values defined 

1811 in :class:`UpdateSeverity`. 

1812 suggest (EnumSymbol): Suggested action a user should take after applying the update. 

1813 This must be one of the values defined in :class:`UpdateSuggestion`. 

1814 locked (bool): Indicates whether or not the update is locked and un-editable. 

1815 This is usually set by the composer because the update is going through a state 

1816 transition. 

1817 pushed (bool): Indicates whether or not the update has been pushed to its requested 

1818 repository. 

1819 critpath (bool): Indicates whether or not the update is for a "critical path" 

1820 :class:`Package`. Critical path packages are packages that are required for 

1821 basic functionality. For example, the kernel :class:`RpmPackage` is a critical 

1822 path package. 

1823 close_bugs (bool): Indicates whether the Bugzilla bugs that this update is related 

1824 to should be closed automatically when the update is pushed to stable. 

1825 date_submitted (DateTime): The date that the update was created. 

1826 date_modified (DateTime): The date the update was last modified or ``None``. 

1827 date_approved (DateTime): The date the update was approved or ``None``. 

1828 date_pushed (DateTime): The date the update was pushed or ``None``. 

1829 date_testing (DateTime): The date the update was placed into the testing repository 

1830 or ``None``. 

1831 date_stable (DateTime): The date the update was placed into the stable repository or 

1832 ``None``. 

1833 alias (str): The update alias (e.g. FEDORA-EPEL-2009-12345). 

1834 release_id (int): A foreign key to the releases ``id``. 

1835 release (Release): The ``Release`` object this update relates to via the ``release_id``. 

1836 comments (sqlalchemy.orm.collections.InstrumentedList): A list of the :class:`Comment` 

1837 objects for this update. 

1838 builds (sqlalchemy.orm.collections.InstrumentedList): A list of :class:`Build` objects 

1839 contained in this update. 

1840 bugs (sqlalchemy.orm.collections.InstrumentedList): A list of :class:`Bug` objects 

1841 associated with this update. 

1842 user_id (int): A foreign key to the :class:`User` that created this update. 

1843 test_gating_status (EnumSymbol): The test gating status of the update. This must be one 

1844 of the values defined in :class:`TestGatingStatus` or ``None``. None indicates that 

1845 Greenwave integration was not enabled when the update was created. 

1846 compose (Compose): The :class:`Compose` that this update is currently being composed in. The 

1847 update is locked if this is defined. 

1848 from_tag (str): The koji tag from which the list of builds was 

1849 originally populated (if any). 

1850 """ 

1851 

1852 __tablename__ = 'updates' 

1853 __exclude_columns__ = ('id', 'user_id', 'release_id') 

1854 __include_extras__ = ('meets_testing_requirements', 'url', 'title', 'version_hash') 

1855 __get_by__ = ('alias',) 

1856 

1857 autokarma = Column(Boolean, default=True, nullable=False) 

1858 autotime = Column(Boolean, default=True, nullable=False) 

1859 stable_karma = Column(Integer, nullable=False) 

1860 stable_days = Column(Integer, nullable=False, default=0) 

1861 unstable_karma = Column(Integer, nullable=False) 

1862 requirements = Column(UnicodeText) 

1863 require_bugs = Column(Boolean, default=False) 

1864 require_testcases = Column(Boolean, default=False) 

1865 

1866 display_name = Column(UnicodeText, nullable=False, default='') 

1867 notes = Column(UnicodeText, nullable=False) # Mandatory notes 

1868 

1869 # Enumerated types 

1870 type = Column(UpdateType.db_type(), nullable=False) 

1871 status = Column(UpdateStatus.db_type(), 

1872 default=UpdateStatus.pending, 

1873 nullable=False, index=True) 

1874 request = Column(UpdateRequest.db_type(), index=True) 

1875 severity = Column(UpdateSeverity.db_type(), default=UpdateSeverity.unspecified) 

1876 suggest = Column(UpdateSuggestion.db_type(), default=UpdateSuggestion.unspecified) 

1877 

1878 # Flags 

1879 locked = Column(Boolean, default=False) 

1880 pushed = Column(Boolean, default=False) 

1881 critpath = Column(Boolean, default=False) 

1882 

1883 # Bug settings 

1884 close_bugs = Column(Boolean, default=True) 

1885 

1886 # Timestamps 

1887 date_submitted = Column(DateTime, default=datetime.utcnow, index=True) 

1888 date_modified = Column(DateTime) 

1889 date_approved = Column(DateTime) 

1890 date_pushed = Column(DateTime) 

1891 date_testing = Column(DateTime) 

1892 date_stable = Column(DateTime) 

1893 

1894 # eg: FEDORA-EPEL-2009-12345 

1895 alias = Column(Unicode(64), unique=True, nullable=False) 

1896 

1897 # Many-to-one relationships 

1898 release_id = Column(Integer, ForeignKey('releases.id'), nullable=False) 

1899 release = relationship('Release', lazy='joined', innerjoin=True) 

1900 

1901 user_id = Column(Integer, ForeignKey('users.id')) 

1902 # user backref from User 

1903 

1904 # If the update is locked and a Compose exists for the same release and request, this will be 

1905 # set to that Compose. 

1906 compose = relationship( 

1907 'Compose', 

1908 primaryjoin=("and_(Update.release_id==Compose.release_id, Update.request==Compose.request, " 

1909 "Update.locked==True)"), 

1910 foreign_keys=(release_id, request), 

1911 backref=backref('updates', passive_deletes=True, order_by='Update.date_submitted')) 

1912 

1913 # One-to-many relationships 

1914 comments = relationship('Comment', backref='update', cascade="all,delete,delete-orphan", 

1915 order_by='Comment.timestamp') 

1916 builds = relationship('Build', backref='update', order_by='Build.nvr') 

1917 

1918 # Many-to-many relationships 

1919 bugs = relationship('Bug', secondary=update_bug_table, backref='updates', order_by='Bug.bug_id') 

1920 

1921 # Greenwave 

1922 test_gating_status = Column(TestGatingStatus.db_type(), default=None, nullable=True) 

1923 

1924 # Koji tag, if any, from which the list of builds was populated initially. 

1925 from_tag = Column(UnicodeText, nullable=True)

1927 def __init__(self, *args, **kwargs): 

1928 """ 

1929 Initialize the Update. 

1930 

1931 We use this as a way to inject an alias into the Update, since it is a required field and 

1932 we don't want callers to have to generate the alias themselves. 

1933 """ 

1934 # Let's give this Update an alias so the DB doesn't become displeased with us. 

1935 if 'release' not in kwargs: 

1936 raise ValueError('You must specify a Release when creating an Update.') 

1937 prefix = kwargs['release'].id_prefix 

1938 year = time.localtime()[0] 

1939 id = hashlib.sha1(str(uuid.uuid4()).encode('utf-8')).hexdigest()[:10] 

1940 alias = '%s-%s-%s' % (prefix, year, id) 

1941 self.alias = alias 

1942 self.release_id = kwargs['release'].id 

1943 

1944 super(Update, self).__init__(*args, **kwargs) 

1945 

1946 log.debug('Set alias for %s to %s' % (self.get_title(), alias)) 

1947 

1948 if self.status == UpdateStatus.testing: 

1949 self._ready_for_testing(self, self.status, None, None) 

1950 

1951 @property 

1952 def version_hash(self): 

1953 """ 

1954 Return a SHA1 hash of the Builds NVRs. 

1955 

1956 Returns: 

1957 str: a SHA1 hash of the builds NVRs. 

1958 """ 

1959 nvrs = [x.nvr for x in self.builds] 

1960 builds = " ".join(sorted(nvrs)) 

1961 return hashlib.sha1(str(builds).encode('utf-8')).hexdigest()

1963 @property 

1964 def side_tag_locked(self): 

1965 """ 

1966 Return the lock state of the side tag. 

1967 

1968 Returns: 

1969 bool: True if sidetag is locked, False otherwise. 

1970 """ 

1971 return self.status == UpdateStatus.side_tag_active and self.request is not None

1973 # WARNING: consumers/composer.py assumes that this validation is performed! 

1974 @validates('builds') 

1975 def validate_builds(self, key, build): 

1976 """ 

1977 Validate builds being appended to ensure they are all the same type. 

1978 

1979 Args: 

1980 key (str): The field's key, which is un-used in this validator. 

1981 build (Build): The build object which was appended to the list 

1982 of builds. 

1983 

1984 Raises: 

1985 ValueError: If the build being appended is not the same type as the 

1986 existing builds. 

1987 """ 

1988 if not all(isinstance(b, type(build)) for b in self.builds): 

1989 raise ValueError('An update must contain builds of the same type.') 

1990 return build 

1991 

1992 @validates('release') 

1993 def validate_release(self, key, release): 

1994 """ 

1995 Make sure the release is the same content type as this update. 

1996 

1997 Args: 

1998 key (str): The field's key, which is un-used in this validator. 

1999 release (Release): The release object which is being associated with this update. 

2000 Raises: 

2001 ValueError: If the release being associated is not the same content type as the 

2002 update. 

2003 """ 

2004 if release and self.content_type is not None: 

2005 u = Update.query.filter(Update.release_id == release.id, Update.id != self.id).first() 

2006 if u and u.content_type and u.content_type != self.content_type: 

2007 raise ValueError('A release must contain updates of the same type.') 

2008 return release

2035 @property 

2036 def karma(self): 

2037 """ 

2038 Calculate and return the karma for the Update. 

2039 

2040 :return: The Update's current karma. 

2041 :rtype: int 

2042 """ 

2043 positive_karma, negative_karma = self._composite_karma 

2044 return positive_karma + negative_karma 

2045 

2046 @property 

2047 def _composite_karma(self): 

2048 """ 

2049 Calculate and return a 2-tuple of the positive and negative karma. 

2050 

2051 Sums the positive karma comments, and then sums the negative karma comments. The total karma 

2052 is simply the sum of the two elements of this 2-tuple. 

2053 

2054 Returns: 

2055 tuple: A 2-tuple of (positive_karma, negative_karma). 

2056 """ 

2057 positive_karma = 0 

2058 negative_karma = 0 

2059 users_counted = set() 

2060 for comment in self.comments_since_karma_reset: 

2061 if comment.karma and comment.user.name not in users_counted: 

2062 # Make sure we only count the last comment this user made 

2063 users_counted.add(comment.user.name) 

2064 if comment.karma > 0: 

2065 positive_karma += comment.karma 

2066 else: 

2067 negative_karma += comment.karma 

2068 

2069 return positive_karma, negative_karma 

2070 

2071 @property 

2072 def comments_since_karma_reset(self): 

2073 """ 

2074 Generate the comments since the most recent karma reset event. 

2075 

2076 Karma is reset when :class:`Builds <Build>` are added or removed from an update. 

2077 

2078 Returns: 

2079 list: class:`Comments <Comment>` since the karma reset. 

2080 """ 

2081 # We want to traverse the comments in reverse order so we only consider 

2082 # the most recent comments from any given user and only the comments 

2083 # since the most recent karma reset event. 

2084 comments_since_karma_reset = [] 

2085 

2086 for comment in reversed(self.comments): 

2087 if comment.user.name == 'bodhi' and \ 

2088 ('New build' in comment.text or 'Removed build' in comment.text): 

2089 # We only want to consider comments since the most recent karma 

2090 # reset, which happens whenever a build is added or removed 

2091 # from an Update. Since we are traversing the comments in 

2092 # reverse order, once we find one of these comments we can 

2093 # simply exit this loop. 

2094 break 

2095 comments_since_karma_reset.append(comment) 

2096 

2097 return comments_since_karma_reset

2099 @staticmethod 

2100 def contains_critpath_component(builds, release_branch): 

2101 """ 

2102 Determine if there is a critpath component in the builds passed in. 

2103 

2104 Args: 

2105 builds (list): :class:`Builds <Build>` to be considered. 

2106 release_branch (str): The name of the git branch associated to the release, 

2107 such as "f25" or "master". 

2108 Returns: 

2109 bool: ``True`` if the update contains a critical path package, ``False`` otherwise. 

2110 Raises: 

2111 RuntimeError: If the PDC did not give us a 200 code. 

2112 """ 

2113 components = defaultdict(list) 

2114 # Get the mess down to a dict of ptype -> [pname] 

2115 for build in builds: 

2116 ptype = build.package.type.value 

2117 pname = build.package.name 

2118 components[ptype].append(pname) 

2119 

2120 for ptype in components: 

2121 if get_critpath_components(release_branch, ptype, frozenset(components[ptype])): 

2122 return True 

2123 

2124 return False

2126 @property 

2127 def greenwave_subject(self): 

2128 """ 

2129 Form and return the proper Greenwave API subject field for this Update. 

2130 

2131 Returns: 

2132 list: A list of dictionaries that are appropriate to be passed to the Greenwave API 

2133 subject field for a decision about this Update. 

2134 """ 

2135 # See discussion on https://pagure.io/greenwave/issue/34 for why we use these subjects. 

2136 subject = [{'item': build.nvr, 'type': 'koji_build'} for build in self.builds] 

2137 subject.append({'item': self.alias, 'type': 'bodhi_update'}) 

2138 return subject 

2139 

2140 def greenwave_request_batches(self, verbose): 

2141 """ 

2142 Form and return the proper Greenwave API requests data for this Update. 

2143 

2144 Returns: 

2145 list: A list of dictionaries that are appropriate to be passed to the Greenwave API 

2146 for a decision about this Update. 

2147 """ 

2148 batch_size = self.greenwave_subject_batch_size 

2149 count = 0 

2150 subjects = self.greenwave_subject 

2151 data = [] 

2152 while count < len(subjects): 

2153 data.append({ 

2154 'product_version': self.product_version, 

2155 'decision_context': self._greenwave_decision_context, 

2156 'subject': subjects[count:count + batch_size], 

2157 'verbose': verbose, 

2158 }) 

2159 count += batch_size 

2160 return data

2184 

2185 @property 

2186 def _greenwave_decision_context(self): 

2187 # We retrieve updates going to testing (status=pending) and updates 

2188 # (status=testing) going to stable. 

2189 # We also query on different contexts for critpath and non-critpath 

2190 # updates. 

2191 # this is correct if update is already in testing... 

2192 context = "bodhi_update_push_stable" 

2193 if self.request == UpdateRequest.testing and self.status == UpdateStatus.pending: 

2194 # ...but if it is pending, we want to know if it can go to testing 

2195 context = "bodhi_update_push_testing" 

2196 if self.critpath: 

2197 context = context + "_critpath" 

2198 return context

2200 def get_test_gating_info(self): 

2201 """ 

2202 Query Greenwave about this update and return the information retrieved. 

2203 

2204 Returns: 

2205 dict: The response from Greenwave for this update. 

2206 Raises: 

2207 BodhiException: When the ``greenwave_api_url`` is undefined in configuration.

2209 """

2213 'subject': self.greenwave_subject,

2218 @property 

2219 def _greenwave_requirements_generator(self): 

2220 """ 

2221 Query Greenwave about this update and return satisfied and unsatisfied requirements. 

2222 

2223 Returns: 

2224 generator: An iterable of 2-tuples of lists of requirement dicts from each request 

2225 batch: first tuple item satisfied requirements, second item unsatisfied requirements. 

2226 Either list or both may be empty. 

2227 

2228 Raises: 

2229 BodhiException: When the ``greenwave_api_url`` is undefined in configuration. 

2230 RuntimeError: If Greenwave did not give us a 200 code, including if no applicable 

2231 policies were found. 

2232 """ 

2233 for data in self.greenwave_request_batches(verbose=False): 

2234 response = util.greenwave_api_post(self._greenwave_api_url, data) 

2235 satisfied = response.get('satisfied_requirements', []) 

2236 unsatisfied = response.get('unsatisfied_requirements', []) 

2237 yield (satisfied, unsatisfied) 

2238 

2239 @property 

2240 def _unsatisfied_requirements(self): 

2241 """Query Greenwave about this update and return all unsatisfied requirements. 

2242 

2243 Returns: 

2244 list: A list of unsatisfied requirement dicts. 

2245 

2246 Raises: 

2247 BodhiException: When the ``greenwave_api_url`` is undefined in configuration. 

2248 RuntimeError: If Greenwave did not give us a 200 code, including if no applicable 

2249 policies were found. 

2250 """ 

2251 ret = [] 

2252 for (_, unsatisfied) in self._greenwave_requirements_generator: 

2253 ret.extend(unsatisfied) 

2254 return ret 

2255 

2256 def _get_test_gating_status(self): 

2257 """ 

2258 Query Greenwave about this update and return the information retrieved. 

2259 

2260 Returns: 

2261 TestGatingStatus: 

2262 - TestGatingStatus.ignored if no tests are required 

2263 - TestGatingStatus.passed if there are required tests and policies are satisfied 

2264 - TestGatingStatus.waiting if there are required tests that have not yet completed, 

2265 no required test has failed, and update was last modified less than 2 hours ago 

2266 - TestGatingStatus.failed otherwise (failed required tests, missing required 

2267 test results and last modified more than 2 hours ago) 

2268 

2269 Raises: 

2270 BodhiException: When the ``greenwave_api_url`` is undefined in configuration. 

2271 RuntimeError: If Greenwave did not give us a 200 code, including if no applicable 

2272 policies were found. 

2273 """ 

2274 gotsat = False 

2275 gotunsat = False 

2276 recent = datetime.utcnow() - self.last_modified < timedelta(hours=2) 

2277 for (satisfied, unsatisfied) in self._greenwave_requirements_generator: 

2278 if satisfied: 

2279 gotsat = True 

2280 if unsatisfied: 

2281 gotunsat = True 

2282 if not recent or not all(req.get('type', '') == 'test-result-missing' 

2283 for req in unsatisfied): 

2284 return TestGatingStatus.failed 

2285 

2286 if not gotsat and not gotunsat: 

2287 return TestGatingStatus.ignored 

2288 

2289 if gotsat and not gotunsat: 

2290 return TestGatingStatus.passed 

2291 

2292 # here, we have unsatisfied requirements but we never bailed early 

2293 # in the for loop, so they are all 'missing' and update was recently modified 

2294 return TestGatingStatus.waiting 

2295 

2296 @property 

2297 def install_command(self) -> str: 

2298 """ 

2299 Return the appropriate command for installing the Update. 

2300 

2301 There are four conditions under which the empty string is returned: 

2302 * If the update is in testing status for rawhide. 

2303 * If the update is not in a stable or testing repository. 

2304 * If the release has not specified a package manager. 

2305 * If the release has not specified a testing repository. 

2306 

2307 Returns: 

2308 The dnf command to install the Update, or the empty string. 

2309 """ 

2310 if not self.release.composed_by_bodhi and self.status == UpdateStatus.testing: 

2311 return '' 

2312 

2313 if self.status != UpdateStatus.stable and self.status != UpdateStatus.testing: 

2314 return '' 

2315 

2316 if self.release.package_manager == PackageManager.unspecified \ 

2317 or self.release.testing_repository is None: 

2318 return '' 

2319 

2320 command = 'sudo {} {}{} --advisory={}{}'.format( 

2321 self.release.package_manager.value, 

2322 'install' if self.type == UpdateType.newpackage else 'upgrade', 

2323 (' --enablerepo=' + self.release.testing_repository) 

2324 if self.status == UpdateStatus.testing else '', 

2325 self.alias, 

2326 r' \*' if self.type == UpdateType.newpackage else '') 

2327 return command

2329 def update_test_gating_status(self): 

2330 """Query Greenwave about this update and set the test_gating_status as appropriate.""" 

2331 try: 

2332 self.test_gating_status = self._get_test_gating_status() 

2333 except (requests.exceptions.Timeout, RuntimeError) as e: 

2334 log.error(str(e)) 

2335 # If we receive a 500 error code from Greenwave, we set the test_gating_status to 

2336 # waiting. The status will then be updated later by the greenwave fedora-messaging 

2337 # consumer. 

2338 self.test_gating_status = TestGatingStatus.waiting

2340 @classmethod 

2341 def new(cls, request, data): 

2342 """ 

2343 Create a new update. 

2344 

2345 Args: 

2346 request (pyramid.request.Request): The current web request. 

2347 data (dict): A key-value mapping of the new update's attributes. 

2348 Returns: 

2349 tuple: A 2-tuple of the edited update and a list of dictionaries that describe caveats. 

2350 Raises: 

2351 RuntimeError: If the PDC did not give us a 200 code. 

2352 """ 

2353 db = request.db 

2354 user = User.get(request.user.name)

2356 caveats = [] 

2357 data['critpath'] = cls.contains_critpath_component( 

2358 data['builds'], data['release'].branch)

2361 # and strip whitespaces from it

2366 # offline in the UpdatesHandler task worker now.

2375 bugs.append(bug) 

2376 data['bugs'] = bugs 

2377 

2378 # If no requirements are provided, then gather some defaults from the 

2379 # packages of the associated builds. 

2380 # See https://github.com/fedora-infra/bodhi/issues/101 

2381 if not data['requirements']: 

2382 data['requirements'] = " ".join(list(set(sum([ 

2383 list(tokenize(pkg.requirements)) for pkg in [ 

2384 build.package for build in data['builds']

2393 release = data.pop('release', None) 

2394 

2395 if not release.composed_by_bodhi: 

2396 # For rawhide updates make sure autotime push is enabled 

2397 # https://github.com/fedora-infra/bodhi/issues/3912 

2398 data['autotime'] = True 

2399 data['stable_days'] = 0 

2400 log.debug("Overriding autotime settings for rawhide update.") 

2401

2403 

2404 # We want to make sure that the value of stable_days 

2405 # will not be lower than the mandatory_days_in_testing. 

2406 if up.mandatory_days_in_testing > up.stable_days: 

2407 up.stable_days = up.mandatory_days_in_testing 

2408 caveats.append({

2410 'description': "The number of stable days required was set to the mandatory "

2412 })

2415 db.add(up) 

2416 log.debug(f"Triggering db commit for new update {up.alias}.") 

2417 db.commit() 

2418

2420 setgs = config.get('test_gating.required') 

2421 # The request to testing for side-tag updates is set within the signed consumer 

2422 if not data.get("from_tag"):

2424 up.set_request(db, req, request.user.name) 

2425 if req == UpdateRequest.testing:

2430 log.debug( 

2431 'Test gating required is enforced, marking the update as waiting on test gating') 

2432 up.test_gating_status = TestGatingStatus.waiting

2434 log.debug(f"Done with Update.new(...) {up.alias}")

2437 @classmethod 

2438 def edit(cls, request, data): 

2439 """ 

2440 Edit the update. 

2441 

2442 Args: 

2443 request (pyramid.request.Request): The current web request. 

2444 data (dict): A key-value mapping of what should be altered in this update. 

2445 Returns: 

2446 tuple: A 2-tuple of the edited update and a list of dictionaries that describe caveats. 

2447 Raises: 

2448 LockedUpdateException: If the update is locked. 

2449 RuntimeError: If the PDC did not give us a 200 code. 

2450 """ 

2451 db = request.db 

2452 buildinfo = request.buildinfo 

2453 up = db.query(Update).filter_by(alias=data['edited']).first() 

2454 del(data['edited']) 

2455 

2456 caveats = [] 

2457 edited_builds = [build.nvr for build in up.builds] 

2458 

2459 # Be sure to not add an empty string as alternative title 

2460 # and strip whitespaces from it 

2461 if 'display_name' in data: 

2462 data['display_name'] = data['display_name'].strip() 

2463 

2464 # stable_days can be set by the user. We want to make sure that the value 

2465 # will not be lower than the mandatory_days_in_testing. 

2466 if up.mandatory_days_in_testing > data.get('stable_days', up.stable_days): 

2467 data['stable_days'] = up.mandatory_days_in_testing 

2468 caveats.append({ 

2469 'name': 'stable days', 

2470 'description': "The number of stable days required was raised to the mandatory " 

2471 f"release value of {up.mandatory_days_in_testing} days" 

2472 }) 

2473 

2474 # Determine which builds have been added 

2475 new_builds = [] 

2476 for build in data['builds']: 

2477 if build not in edited_builds: 

2478 if up.locked: 

2479 raise LockedUpdateException("Can't add builds to a " 

2480 "locked update") 

2481 

2482 new_builds.append(build) 

2483 Package.get_or_create(db, buildinfo[build]) 

2484 b = db.query(Build).filter_by(nvr=build).first() 

2485 

2486 up.builds.append(b) 

2487 

2488 # Determine which builds have been removed 

2489 removed_builds = [] 

2490 for build in edited_builds: 

2491 if build not in data['builds']: 

2492 if up.locked: 

2493 raise LockedUpdateException("Can't remove builds from a " 

2494 "locked update") 

2495 

2496 removed_builds.append(build) 

2497 b = None 

2498 for b in up.builds: 2498 ↛ 2502line 2498 didn't jump to line 2502, because the loop on line 2498 didn't complete

2499 if b.nvr == build: 2499 ↛ 2498line 2499 didn't jump to line 2498, because the condition on line 2499 was never false

2500 break 

2501 

2502 b.unpush(koji=request.koji) 

2503 up.builds.remove(b) 

2504

2682 pkgs = [b.package.name for b in self.builds] 

2683 for _build in oldBuild.update.builds: 

2684 if _build.package.name not in pkgs: 

2685 obsoletable = False

2713

3077 comment (str): A comment from the user describing their decision. 

3078 tests (list of str): A list of testcases to be waived. Defaults to ``None`` 

3079 If left as ``None``, all ``unsatisfied_requirements`` returned by greenwave 

3080 will be waived, otherwise only the testcase found in both list will be waived. 

3081 Raises: 

3082 LockedUpdateException: If the Update is locked. 

3083 BodhiException: If test gating is not enabled in this Bodhi instance, 

3084 or if the tests have passed. 

3085 RuntimeError: Either WaiverDB or Greenwave did not give us a 200 code. 

3086 """ 

3087 log.debug('Attempting to waive test results for this update %s' % self.alias) 

3088 

3089 if self.locked: 

3090 raise LockedUpdateException("Can't waive test results on a " 

3091 "locked update") 

3092 

3093 if not config.get('test_gating.required'): 

3094 raise BodhiException('Test gating is not enabled') 

3095 

3096 if self.test_gating_passed: 

3097 raise BodhiException("Can't waive test results on an update that passes test gating") 

3098 

3099 # Ensure we can always iterate over tests 

3100 tests = tests or [] 

3101 

3102 for requirement in self._unsatisfied_requirements: 

3103 

3104 if tests and requirement['testcase'] not in tests: 

3105 continue 

3106 

3107 data = { 

3108 'subject': requirement['item'], 

3109 'testcase': requirement['testcase'], 

3110 'product_version': self.product_version, 

3111 'waived': True, 

3112 'username': username, 

3113 'comment': comment 

3114 } 

3115 log.debug('Waiving test results: %s' % data) 

3116 util.waiverdb_api_post( 

3117 '{}/waivers/'.format(config.get('waiverdb_api_url')), data) 

3118 

3119 self.test_gating_status = TestGatingStatus.waiting

3319 def update_bugs(self, bug_ids, session): 

3320 """ 

3321 Make the update's bugs consistent with the given list of bug ids. 

3322 

3323 Create any new bugs, and remove any missing ones. Destroy removed bugs that are no longer 

3324 referenced anymore. If any associated bug is found to be a security bug, alter the update to 

3325 be a security update. 

3326 

3327 Args: 

3328 bug_ids (list): A list of strings of bug ids to associate with this update. 

3329 session (sqlalchemy.orm.session.Session): A database session. 

3330 Returns: 

3331 list: :class:`Bugs <Bug>` that are newly associated with the update. 

3332 """ 

3333 to_remove = [bug for bug in self.bugs if bug.bug_id not in bug_ids] 

3334 

3335 for bug in to_remove: 

3336 self.bugs.remove(bug) 

3337 if len(bug.updates) == 0: 

3338 # Don't delete the Bug instance if there is any associated BugKarma 

3339 if not session.query(BugKarma).filter_by(bug_id=bug.bug_id).count(): 

3340 log.debug("Destroying stray Bugzilla #%d" % bug.bug_id) 

3341 session.delete(bug) 

3342 session.flush() 

3343 

3344 new = [] 

3345 for bug_id in bug_ids: 

3346 bug = Bug.get(int(bug_id)) 

3347 if not bug: 

3348 bug = Bug(bug_id=int(bug_id)) 

3349 session.add(bug) 

3350 session.flush() 

3351 if bug not in self.bugs: 

3352 self.bugs.append(bug) 

3353 new.append(bug.bug_id) 

3354 if bug.security and self.type != UpdateType.security: 

3355 self.type = UpdateType.security 

3356 

3357 session.flush() 

3358 return new

3375 def comment(self, session, text, karma=0, author=None, karma_critpath=0, 

3376 bug_feedback=None, testcase_feedback=None, check_karma=True, 

3377 email_notification=True): 

3378 """Add a comment to this update. 

3379 

3380 If the karma reaches the 'stable_karma' value, then request that this update be marked 

3381 as stable. If it reaches the 'unstable_karma', it is unpushed. 

3382 """ 

3383 if not author: 

3384 raise ValueError('You must provide a comment author') 

3385 

3386 # Listify these 

3387 bug_feedback = bug_feedback or [] 

3388 testcase_feedback = testcase_feedback or [] 

3389 

3390 got_feedback = False 

3391 for feedback_dict in (bug_feedback + testcase_feedback): 

3392 if feedback_dict['karma'] != 0: 

3393 got_feedback = True 

3394 break 

3395 

3396 if (not text and not karma and not karma_critpath and not got_feedback): 

3397 raise ValueError('You must provide either some text or feedback') 

3398 

3399 caveats = [] 

3400 

3401 if self.user.name == author: 

3402 if karma != 0: 

3403 karma = 0 

3404 notice = 'You may not give karma to your own updates.' 

3405 caveats.append({'name': 'karma', 'description': notice}) 

3406 

3407 try: 

3408 user = session.query(User).filter_by(name=author).one() 

3409 except NoResultFound: 

3410 user = User(name=author) 

3411 session.add(user) 

3412 

3413 comment = Comment(text=text, karma=karma, karma_critpath=karma_critpath, 

3414 update=self, user=user) 

3415 session.add(comment) 

3416 

3417 if karma != 0: 

3418 # Determine whether this user has already left karma, and if so what the most recent 

3419 # karma value they left was. We should examine all but the most recent comment, since 

3420 # that is the comment we just added. 

3421 previous_karma = None 

3422 for c in reversed(self.comments[:-1]): 

3423 if c.user.name == author and c.karma: 

3424 previous_karma = c.karma 

3425 break 

3426 if previous_karma and karma != previous_karma: 

3427 caveats.append({ 

3428 'name': 'karma', 

3429 'description': 'Your karma standing was reversed.', 

3430 }) 

3431 else: 

3432 log.debug('Ignoring duplicate %d karma from %s on %s', karma, author, self.alias) 

3433 

3434 log.info("Updated %s karma to %d", self.alias, self.karma) 

3435 

3436 if check_karma and author not in config.get('system_users'): 

3437 try: 

3438 self.check_karma_thresholds(session, 'bodhi') 

3439 except LockedUpdateException: 

3440 pass 

3441 except BodhiException as e: 

3442 # This gets thrown if the karma is pushed over the 

3443 # threshold, but it is a critpath update that is not 

3444 # critpath_approved. ... among other cases. 

3445 log.exception('Problem checking the karma threshold.') 

3446 caveats.append({ 

3447 'name': 'karma', 'description': str(e), 

3448 }) 

3449 

3450 # Obsolete pending update if it reaches unstable karma threshold 

3451 self.obsolete_if_unstable(session) 

3452 

3453 session.flush() 

3454 

3455 for feedback_dict in bug_feedback: 

3456 feedback = BugKarma(**feedback_dict) 

3457 session.add(feedback) 

3458 comment.bug_feedback.append(feedback) 

3459 

3460 for feedback_dict in testcase_feedback: 

3461 feedback = TestCaseKarma(**feedback_dict) 

3462 session.add(feedback) 

3463 comment.testcase_feedback.append(feedback) 

3464 

3465 session.flush() 

3466 

3467 # Publish to Fedora Messaging 

3468 if author not in config.get('system_users'): 

3469 notifications.publish(update_schemas.UpdateCommentV1.from_dict( 

3470 {'comment': comment.__json__(), 'agent': author})) 

3471 

3472 # Send a notification to everyone that has commented on this update 

3473 people = set() 

3474 for person in self.get_maintainers(): 

3475 if person.email: 3475 ↛ 3476line 3475 didn't jump to line 3476, because the condition on line 3475 was never true

3476 people.add(person.email) 

3477 else: 

3478 people.add(person.name) 

3479 for comment in self.comments: 

3480 if comment.user.name in ['anonymous', 'bodhi']: 

3481 continue 

3482 if comment.user.email: 

3483 people.add(comment.user.email) 

3484 else: 

3485 people.add(comment.user.name) 

3486 if email_notification: 

3487 mail.send(people, 'comment', self, sender=None, agent=author) 

3488 return comment, caveats

3621 def check_requirements(self, session, settings): 

3622 """ 

3623 Check that an update meets its self-prescribed policy to be pushed. 

3624 

3625 Args: 

3626 session (sqlalchemy.orm.session.Session): A database session. Unused. 

3627 settings (bodhi.server.config.BodhiConfig): Bodhi's settings. 

3628 Returns: 

3629 tuple: A tuple containing (result, reason) where result is a bool 

3630 and reason is a str. 

3631 """ 

3632 if config.get('test_gating.required') and not self.test_gating_passed: 

3633 return (False, "Required tests did not pass on this update") 

3634 

3635 requirements = tokenize(self.requirements or '') 

3636 requirements = list(requirements) 

3637 

3638 if not requirements: 

3639 return True, "No checks required."
