3641 try: 

3642 # https://github.com/fedora-infra/bodhi/issues/362 

3643 since = self.last_modified.isoformat().rsplit('.', 1)[0] 

3644 except Exception as e: 

3645 log.exception("Failed to determine last_modified from %r : %r", 

3646 self.last_modified, str(e)) 

3647 return False, "Failed to determine last_modified: %r" % str(e) 

3648

3650 # query results for this update 

3651 query = dict(type='bodhi_update', item=self.alias, since=since, 

3652 testcases=','.join(requirements)) 

3653 results = list(util.taskotron_results(settings, **query)) 

3654 

3655 # query results for each build 

3656 # retrieve timestamp for each build so that queries can be optimized 

3657 koji = buildsys.get_session()

3659 for build in self.builds:

3662 

3663 for index, build in enumerate(self.builds): 

3664 multicall_response = buildinfos[index] 

3665 if not isinstance(multicall_response, list) \ 

3666 or not isinstance(multicall_response[0], dict): 

3667 msg = ("Error retrieving data from Koji for %r: %r" % 

3668 (build.nvr, multicall_response)) 

3669 log.error(msg) 

3670 raise TypeError(msg) 

3671 

3672 buildinfo = multicall_response[0] 

3673 ts = datetime.utcfromtimestamp(buildinfo['completion_ts']).isoformat() 

3674 

3675 query = dict(type='koji_build', item=build.nvr, since=ts, 

3676 testcases=','.join(requirements)) 

3677 build_results = list(util.taskotron_results(settings, **query)) 

3678 results.extend(build_results) 

3679 

3680 except Exception as e: 

3681 log.exception("Failed retrieving requirements results: %r", str(e)) 

3682 return False, "Failed retrieving requirements results: %r" % str(e) 

3683 

3684 for testcase in requirements: 

3685 relevant = [result for result in results 

3686 if result['testcase']['name'] == testcase] 

3687 

3688 if not relevant: 

3689 return False, 'No result found for required testcase %s' % testcase 

3690 

3691 by_arch = defaultdict(list) 

3692 for result in relevant: 

3693 arch = result['data'].get('arch', ['noarch'])[0] 

3694 by_arch[arch].append(result) 

3695 

3696 for arch, result in by_arch.items(): 

3697 latest = relevant[0] # resultsdb results are ordered chronologically 

3698 if latest['outcome'] not in ['PASSED', 'INFO']: 

3699 return False, "Required task %s returned %s" % ( 

3700 latest['testcase']['name'], latest['outcome']) 

3701 

3702 # TODO - check require_bugs and require_testcases also? 

3703 

3704 return True, "All checks pass." 

3705 

3706 def check_karma_thresholds(self, db, agent): 

3707 """ 

3708 Check if we have reached either karma threshold, and adjust state as necessary. 

3709 

3710 This method will call :meth:`set_request` if necessary. If the update is locked, it will 

3711 ignore karma thresholds and raise an Exception. 

3712 

3713 Args: 

3714 db (sqlalchemy.orm.session.Session): A database session. 

3715 agent (str): The username of the user who has provided karma. 

3716 Raises: 

3717 LockedUpdateException: If the update is locked. 

3718 """ 

3719 # Raise Exception if the update is locked 

3720 if self.locked: 

3721 log.debug('%s locked. Ignoring karma thresholds.', self.alias) 

3722 raise LockedUpdateException 

3723 # Return if the status of the update is not in testing or pending 

3724 if self.status not in (UpdateStatus.testing, UpdateStatus.pending): 

3725 return 

3726 # If an update receives negative karma disable autopush 

3727 if (self.autokarma or self.autotime) and self._composite_karma[1] != 0 and self.status is \ 

3728 UpdateStatus.testing and self.request is not UpdateRequest.stable: 

3729 log.info("Disabling Auto Push since the update has received negative karma") 

3730 self.autokarma = False 

3731 self.autotime = False 

3732 text = config.get('disable_automatic_push_to_stable') 

3733 self.comment(db, text, author='bodhi') 

3734 elif self.stable_karma and self.karma >= self.stable_karma: 

3735 if config.get('test_gating.required') and not self.test_gating_passed: 

3736 log.info("%s reached stable karma threshold, but does not meet gating " 

3737 "requirements", self.alias) 

3738 return 

3739 if self.autokarma: 

3740 log.info("Automatically marking %s as stable", self.alias) 

3741 self.set_request(db, UpdateRequest.stable, agent) 

3742 self.date_pushed = None 

3743 notifications.publish(update_schemas.UpdateKarmaThresholdV1.from_dict( 

3744 dict(update=self, status='stable'))) 

3745 else: 

3746 # Add the stable approval message now 

3747 log.info(( 

3748 "%s update has reached the stable karma threshold and can be pushed to " 

3749 "stable now if the maintainer wishes"), self.alias) 

3750 elif self.unstable_karma and self.karma <= self.unstable_karma: 

3751 if self.status is UpdateStatus.pending and not self.autokarma: 

3752 pass 

3753 else: 

3754 log.info("Automatically unpushing %s", self.alias) 

3755 self.obsolete(db) 

3756 notifications.publish(update_schemas.UpdateKarmaThresholdV1.from_dict( 

3757 dict(update=self, status='unstable')))

3779 @property 

3780 def last_modified(self): 

3781 """ 

3782 Return the last time this update was edited or created. 

3783 

3784 This gets used specifically by taskotron/resultsdb queries so we only 

3785 query for test runs that occur *after* the last time this update 

3786 (in its current form) was in play. 

3787 

3788 Returns: 

3789 datetime.datetime: The most recent time of modification or creation. 

3790 Raises: 

3791 ValueError: If the update has no timestamps set, which should not be possible. 

3792 """ 

3793 # Prune out None values that have not been set 

3794 possibilities = [self.date_submitted, self.date_modified] 

3795 possibilities = [p for p in possibilities if p] 

3796 

3797 if not possibilities: # Should be un-possible. 

3798 raise ValueError("Update has no timestamps set: %r" % self) 

3799 

3800 possibilities.sort() # Sort smallest to largest (oldest to newest) 

3801 return possibilities[-1] # Return the last one

3825 @property 

3826 def meets_testing_requirements(self): 

3827 """ 

3828 Return whether or not this update meets its release's testing requirements. 

3829 

3830 If this update's release does not have a mandatory testing requirement, then 

3831 simply return True. 

3832 

3833 Returns: 

3834 bool: True if the update meets testing requirements, False otherwise. 

3835 """ 

3836 num_days = self.mandatory_days_in_testing 

3837 

3838 if config.get('test_gating.required') and not self.test_gating_passed: 

3839 return False 

3840 

3841 if self.karma >= self.release.critpath_min_karma: 

3842 return True 

3843 

3844 if self.critpath: 

3845 # Ensure there is no negative karma. We're looking at the sum of 

3846 # each users karma for this update, which takes into account 

3847 # changed votes. 

3848 if self._composite_karma[1] < 0: 

3849 return False 

3850 return self.days_in_testing >= num_days 

3851 

3852 if not num_days: 

3853 return True 

3854 

3855 if self.karma >= self.stable_karma: 

3856 return True 

3857 

3858 # Any update that reaches num_days has met the testing requirements. 

3859 return self.days_in_testing >= num_days

3963 @property 

3964 def requested_tag(self): 

3965 """ 

3966 Return the tag the update has requested. 

3967 

3968 Returns: 

3969 str: The Koji tag that corresponds to the update's current request. 

3970 Raises: 

3971 RuntimeError: If a Koji tag is unable to be determined. 

3972 """ 

3973 tag = None

3976 # [No Frozen Rawhide] Move stable builds going to a pending 

3977 # release to the Release.dist-tag 

3978 if self.release.state is ReleaseState.pending: 

3979 tag = self.release.dist_tag 

3980 elif self.request == UpdateRequest.testing: 

3981 tag = self.release.testing_tag 

3982 elif self.request is UpdateRequest.obsolete: 

3983 tag = self.release.candidate_tag 

3984 if not tag: 

3985 raise RuntimeError( 

3986 f'Unable to determine requested tag for {self.alias}.') 

3987 return tag

3990 """

3992

4000 # Duplicate alias as updateid for backwards compat with bodhi1

4015 seen=seen, 

4016 request=request) 

4017 for test in self.full_test_cases

4020 return result

4048 def _build_group_test_message(self, agent="bodhi", retrigger=False): 

4049 """ 

4050 Build the dictionary sent when an update is ready to be tested. 

4051 

4052 This is used in bodhi.server.models.Update._ready_for_testing and in 

4053 bodhi.server.services.updates.trigger_tests which are the two places 

4054 where we send notifications about an update being ready to be tested 

4055 by any CI system. 

4056 

4057 Args: 

4058 agent (str): For the case where the message is sent as a test 

4059 re-trigger request, the user who requested it. Otherwise, 

4060 'bodhi'.

4062 trigger request. 

4063 Returns: 

4064 dict: A dictionary corresponding to the message sent 

4065 """ 

4066 contact = { 

4067 "name": "Bodhi", 

4068 "email": "admin@fp.o", 

4069 "team": "Fedora CI", 

4070 "docs": "https://docs.fedoraproject.org/en-US/ci/", 

4071 } 

4072 builds = [] 

4073 for build in self.builds: 

4074 builds.append({ 

4075 "type": "koji-build", 

4076 "id": build.get_build_id(), 

4077 "task_id": build.get_task_id(), 

4078 "issuer": build.get_owner_name(), 

4079 "component": build.nvr_name, 

4080 "nvr": build.nvr, 

4081 "scratch": False, 

4082 }) 

4083 

4084 artifact = { 

4085 "type": "koji-build-group", 

4086 "id": f"{self.alias}-{self.version_hash}", 

4087 "repository": self.abs_url(), 

4088 "builds": builds, 

4089 "release": self.release.dist_tag, 

4090 } 

4091 return { 

4092 "contact": contact, 

4093 "artifact": artifact, 

4094 "generated_at": datetime.utcnow().isoformat() + 'Z', 

4095 "version": "0.2.2", 

4096 'agent': agent, 

4097 're-trigger': retrigger, 

4098 }

4147 

4148class Compose(Base): 

4149 """ 

4150 Express the status of an in-progress compose job. 

4151 

4152 This object is used in a few ways: 

4153 

4154 * It ensures that only one compose process runs per repo, serving as a compose "lock". 

4155 * It marks which updates are part of a compose, serving as an update "lock". 

4156 * It gives the compose process a place to log which step it is in, which will allow us to 

4157 provide compose monitoring tools. 

4158 

4159 Attributes: 

4160 __exclude_columns__ (tuple): A tuple of columns to exclude when __json__() is called. 

4161 __include_extras__ (tuple): A tuple of attributes to add when __json__() is called. 

4162 __tablename__ (str): The name of the table in the database. 

4163 checkpoints (str): A JSON serialized object describing the checkpoints the composer has 

4164 reached. 

4165 date_created (datetime.datetime): The time this Compose was created. 

4166 error_message (str): An error message indicating what happened if the Compose failed. 

4167 id (None): We don't want the superclass's primary key since we will use a natural primary 

4168 key for this model. 

4169 release_id (int): The primary key of the :class:`Release` that is being composed. Forms half 

4170 of the primary key, with the other half being the ``request``. 

4171 request (UpdateRequest): The request of the release that is being composed. Forms half of 

4172 the primary key, with the other half being the ``release_id``. 

4173 release (Release): The release that is being composed. 

4174 state_date (datetime.datetime): The time of the most recent change to the state attribute. 

4175 state (ComposeState): The state of the compose. 

4176 updates (sqlalchemy.orm.collections.InstrumentedList): An iterable of updates included in 

4177 this compose. 

4178 """ 

4179 

4180 __exclude_columns__ = ('updates') 

4181 # We need to include content_type and security so the composer can collate the Composes and so 

4182 # it can pick the right composer class to use. 

4183 __include_extras__ = ('content_type', 'security', 'update_summary') 

4184 __tablename__ = 'composes' 

4185 

4186 # These together form the primary key. 

4187 release_id = Column(Integer, ForeignKey('releases.id'), primary_key=True, nullable=False) 

4188 request = Column(UpdateRequest.db_type(), primary_key=True, nullable=False) 

4189 

4190 # The parent class gives us an id primary key, but we'd rather have a "natural" primary key, so 

4191 # let's override it and set to None. 

4192 id = None 

4193 # We could use the JSON type here, but that would require PostgreSQL >= 9.2.0. We don't really 

4194 # need the ability to query inside this so the JSONB type probably isn't useful. 

4195 checkpoints = Column(UnicodeText, nullable=False, default='{}') 

4196 error_message = Column(UnicodeText) 

4197 date_created = Column(DateTime, nullable=False, default=datetime.utcnow) 

4198 state_date = Column(DateTime, nullable=False, default=datetime.utcnow) 

4199 

4200 release = relationship('Release', backref='composes') 

4201 state = Column(ComposeState.db_type(), nullable=False, default=ComposeState.requested) 

4202 

4203 @property 

4204 def content_type(self): 

4205 """ 

4206 Return the content_type of this compose. 

4207 

4208 Returns: 

4209 (ContentType or None): The content type of this compose, or None if there are no 

4210 associated :class:`Updates <Update>`. 

4211 """ 

4212 if self.updates: 

4213 return self.updates[0].content_type 

4214 

4215 @classmethod 

4216 def from_dict(cls, db, compose): 

4217 """ 

4218 Return a :class:`Compose` instance from the given dict representation of it. 

4219 

4220 Args: 

4221 db (sqlalchemy.orm.session.Session): A database session to use to query for the compose. 

4222 compose (dict): A dictionary representing the compose, in the format returned by 

4223 :meth:`Compose.__json__`. 

4224 Returns: 

4225 bodhi.server.models.Compose: The requested compose instance. 

4226 """ 

4227 return db.query(cls).filter_by( 

4228 release_id=compose['release_id'], 

4229 request=UpdateRequest.from_string(compose['request'])).one() 

4230 

4231 @classmethod 

4232 def from_updates(cls, updates): 

4233 """ 

4234 Return a list of Compose objects to compose the given updates. 

4235 

4236 The updates will be collated by release, request, and content type, and will be added to 

4237 new Compose objects that match those groupings. 

4238 

4239 Note that calling this will cause each of the updates to become locked once the transaction 

4240 is committed. 

4241 

4242 Args: 

4243 updates (list): A list of :class:`Updates <Update>` that you wish to Compose. 

4244 Returns: 

4245 list: A list of new compose objects for the given updates. 

4246 """ 

4247 work = {} 

4248 for update in updates: 

4249 if not update.request: 

4250 log.info('%s request was revoked', update.alias) 

4251 continue 

4252 # ASSUMPTION: For now, updates can only be of a single type. 

4253 ctype = None 

4254 if not update.builds: 

4255 log.info(f"No builds in {update.alias}. Skipping.") 

4256 continue 

4257 for build in update.builds: 

4258 if ctype is None: 

4259 ctype = build.type 

4260 elif ctype is not build.type: # pragma: no cover 

4261 # This branch is not covered because the Update.validate_builds validator 

4262 # catches the same assumption breakage. This check here is extra for the 

4263 # time when someone adds multitype updates and forgets to update this. 

4264 raise ValueError(f'Builds of multiple types found in {update.alias}') 

4265 # This key is just to insert things in the same place in the "work" 

4266 # dict. 

4267 key = '%s-%s' % (update.release.name, update.request.value) 

4268 if key not in work: 

4269 work[key] = cls(request=update.request, release_id=update.release.id, 

4270 release=update.release) 

4271 # Lock the Update. This implicitly adds it to the Compose because the Update.compose 

4272 # relationship joins on the Compose's compound pk for locked Updates. 

4273 update.locked = True 

4274 

4275 # We cast to a list here because a dictionary's values() method does not return a list in 

4276 # Python 3 and the docblock states that a list is returned. 

4277 return list(work.values()) 

4278 

4279 @property 

4280 def security(self): 

4281 """ 

4282 Return whether this compose is a security related compose or not. 

4283 

4284 Returns: 

4285 bool: ``True`` if any of the :class:`Updates <Update>` in this compose are marked as 

4286 security updates. 

4287 """ 

4288 for update in self.updates: 

4289 if update.type is UpdateType.security: 

4290 return True 

4291 return False 

4292 

4293 @staticmethod 

4294 def update_state_date(target, value, old, initiator): 

4295 """ 

4296 Update the ``state_date`` when the state changes. 

4297 

4298 Args: 

4299 target (Compose): The compose that has had a change to its state attribute. 

4300 value (EnumSymbol): The new value of the state. 

4301 old (EnumSymbol): The old value of the state 

4302 initiator (sqlalchemy.orm.attributes.Event): The event object that is initiating this 

4303 transition. 

4304 """ 

4305 if value != old: 

4306 target.state_date = datetime.utcnow() 

4307 

4308 @property 

4309 def update_summary(self): 

4310 """ 

4311 Return a summary of the updates attribute, suitable for transmitting via the API. 

4312 

4313 Returns:

4315 and title associated with this Compose.

4317 return [{'alias': u.alias, 

4318 'title': u.get_title(nvr=True, beautify=True)} for u in self.updates]

4320 def __json__(self, request=None, exclude=None, include=None, composer=False): 

4321 """ 

4322 Serialize this compose in JSON format. 

4323 

4324 Args: 

4325 request (pyramid.request.Request or None): The current web request, or None. 

4326 exclude (iterable or None): See superclass docblock. 

4327 include (iterable or None): See superclass docblock. 

4328 composer (bool): If True, increase the number of excluded attributes so that only the 

4329 attributes required by the Composer to identify Composes are included. Defaults to 

4330 False. If used, overrides exclude and include. 

4331 Returns: 

4332 str: A JSON representation of the Compose. 

4333 """ 

4334 if composer: 

4335 exclude = ('checkpoints', 'error_message', 'date_created', 'state_date', 'release', 

4336 'state', 'updates') 

4337 # We need to include content_type and security so the composer can collate the Composes 

4338 # and so it can pick the right composer class to use. 

4339 include = ('content_type', 'security') 

4340 return super(Compose, self).__json__(request=request, exclude=exclude, include=include) 

4341 

4342 def __lt__(self, other): 

4343 """ 

4344 Return ``True`` if this compose has a higher priority than the other. 

4345 

4346 Args: 

4347 other (Compose): Another compose we are comparing this compose to for sorting. 

4348 Return: 

4349 bool: ``True`` if this compose has a higher priority than the other, else ``False``. 

4350 """ 

4351 if self.security and not other.security: 

4352 return True 

4353 if other.security and not self.security: 

4354 return False 

4355 if self.request == UpdateRequest.stable and other.request != UpdateRequest.stable: 

4356 return True 

4357 return False

4365 """ 

4366 return '<Compose: {} {}>'.format(self.release.name, self.request.description) 

4367 

4368 

4369event.listen(Compose.state, 'set', Compose.update_state_date, active_history=True)

4463 

4464 @property 

4465 def unique_testcase_feedback(self) -> typing.List[TestCaseKarma]: 

4466 """ 

4467 Return a list of unique :class:`TestCaseKarma` objects found in the testcase_feedback. 

4468 

4469 This will filter out duplicates for :class:`TestCases <TestCase>`. It will return the 

4470 correct number of TestCases in testcase_feedback as a list. 

4471 

4472 Returns: 

4473 A list of unique :class:`TestCaseKarma` objects associated with this comment. 

4474 """ 

4475 feedbacks = self.testcase_feedback 

4476 unique_feedbacks = set() 

4477 filtered_feedbacks = list() 

4478 for feedback in feedbacks: 

4479 if feedback.testcase.name not in unique_feedbacks: 4479 ↛ 4478line 4479 didn't jump to line 4478, because the condition on line 4479 was never false

4480 unique_feedbacks.add(feedback.testcase.name) 

4481 filtered_feedbacks.append(feedback) 

4482 

4483 return filtered_feedbacks 

4484 

4485 @property

4488 Return a formatted title for the comment using update alias and comment id.

4492 """ 

4493 return "{} comment #{}".format(self.update.alias, self.id) 

4494 

4495 def __json__(self, *args, **kwargs) -> dict: 

4496 """ 

4497 Return a JSON string representation of this comment. 

4498 

4499 Args: 

4500 args: A list of extra args to pass on to :meth:`BodhiBase.__json__`. 

4501 kwargs: Extra kwargs to pass on to :meth:`BodhiBase.__json__`. 

4502 Returns: 

4503 A JSON-serializable dict representation of this comment. 

4504 """ 

4505 result = super(Comment, self).__json__(*args, **kwargs) 

4506 # Duplicate 'user' as 'author' just for backwards compat with bodhi1. 

4507 # Things like the message schemas and fedbadges rely on this. 

4508 if result['user']: 4508 ↛ 4512line 4508 didn't jump to line 4512, because the condition on line 4508 was never false

4509 result['author'] = result['user']['name'] 

4510 

4511 # Similarly, duplicate the update's alias as update_alias. 

4512 result['update_alias'] = result['update']['alias'] 

4513 

4514 # Updates used to have a karma column which would be included in result['update']. The 

4515 # column was replaced with a property, so we need to include it here for backwards 

4516 # compatibility. 

4517 result['update']['karma'] = self.update.karma 

4518 

4519 return result 

4520 

4521 def __str__(self) -> str: 

4522 """ 

4523 Return a str representation of this comment. 

4524 

4525 Returns: 

4526 A str representation of this comment. 

4527 """ 

4528 karma = '0' 

4529 if self.karma != 0: 

4530 karma = '%+d' % (self.karma,) 

4531 return "%s - %s (karma: %s)\n%s" % (self.user.name, self.timestamp, karma, self.text)

4586 

4587 def default_message(self, update: Update) -> str: 

4588 """ 

4589 Return a default comment to add to a bug with add_comment(). 

4590 

4591 Args: 

4592 update: The update that is related to the bug. 

4593 Returns: 

4594 The default comment to add to the bug related to the given update. 

4595 """ 

4596 install_msg = ( 

4597 f'Soon you\'ll be able to install the update with the following ' 

4598 f'command:\n`{update.install_command}`') if update.install_command else '' 

4599 msg_data = {'update_title': update.get_title(delim=", ", nvr=True), 

4600 'update_beauty_title': update.get_title(beautify=True, nvr=True), 

4601 'update_alias': update.alias, 

4602 'repo': f'{update.release.long_name} {update.status.description}', 

4603 'install_instructions': install_msg, 

4604 'update_url': f'{config.get("base_address")}{update.get_url()}'} 

4605 

4606 if update.status is UpdateStatus.stable: 

4607 message = config['stable_bug_msg'].format(**msg_data) 

4608 elif update.status is UpdateStatus.testing: 

4609 if update.release.id_prefix == "FEDORA-EPEL": 

4610 if 'testing_bug_epel_msg' in config: 

4611 template = config['testing_bug_epel_msg'] 

4612 else: 

4613 template = config['testing_bug_msg'] 

4614 log.warning("No 'testing_bug_epel_msg' found in the config.") 

4615 else: 

4616 template = config['testing_bug_msg'] 

4617 message = template.format(**msg_data) 

4618 else: 

4619 raise ValueError(f'Trying to post a default comment to a bug, but ' 

4620 f'{update.alias} is not in Stable or Testing status.') 

4621 

4622 return message 

4623 

4624 def add_comment(self, update: Update, comment: typing.Optional[str] = None) -> None: 

4625 """ 

4626 Add a comment to the bug, pertaining to the given update. 

4627 

4628 Args: 

4629 update: The update that is related to the bug. 

4630 comment: The comment to add to the bug. If None, a default message 

4631 is added to the bug. Defaults to None. 

4632 """ 

4633 if update.type is UpdateType.security and self.parent \ 

4634 and update.status is not UpdateStatus.stable: 

4635 log.debug('Not commenting on parent security bug %s', self.bug_id) 

4636 else: 

4637 if not comment: 

4638 comment = self.default_message(update) 

4639 log.debug("Adding comment to Bug #%d: %s" % (self.bug_id, comment)) 

4640 bugs.bugtracker.comment(self.bug_id, comment) 

4641 

4642 def testing(self, update: Update) -> None: 

4643 """ 

4644 Change the status of this bug to ON_QA. 

4645 

4646 Also, comment on the bug with some details on how to test and provide feedback for the given 

4647 update. 

4648 

4649 Args: 

4650 update: The update associated with the bug. 

4651 """ 

4652 # Skip modifying Security Response bugs for testing updates 

4653 if update.type is UpdateType.security and self.parent: 

4654 log.debug('Not modifying parent security bug %s', self.bug_id) 

4655 else: 

4656 comment = self.default_message(update) 

4657 bugs.bugtracker.on_qa(self.bug_id, comment) 

4658 

4659 def close_bug(self, update: Update) -> None: 

4660 """ 

4661 Close the bug. 

4662 

4663 Args: 

4664 update: The update associated with the bug. 

4665 """ 

4666 # Build a mapping of package names to build versions 

4667 # so that .close() can figure out which build version fixes which bug. 

4668 versions = dict([ 

4669 (b.nvr_name, b.nvr) for b in update.builds 

4670 ]) 

4671 bugs.bugtracker.close(self.bug_id, versions=versions, comment=self.default_message(update)) 

4672 

4673 def modified(self, update: Update, comment: str) -> None: 

4674 """ 

4675 Change the status of this bug to MODIFIED unless it is a parent security bug. 

4676 

4677 Also, comment on the bug stating that an update has been submitted. 

4678 

4679 Args: 

4680 update: The update that is associated with this bug. 

4681 comment: A comment to leave on the bug when modifying it. 

4682 """ 

4683 if update.type is UpdateType.security and self.parent: 

4684 log.debug('Not modifying parent security bug %s', self.bug_id) 

4685 else: 

4686 bugs.bugtracker.modified(self.bug_id, comment)

4773 

4774class BuildrootOverride(Base): 

4775 """ 

4776 This model represents a Koji buildroot override. 

4777 

4778 A buildroot override is a way to add a build to the Koji buildroot (the set of packages used 

4779 to build a package) manually. Normally, builds are only available after they are pushed to 

4780 "stable", but this allows a build to be added to the buildroot immediately. This is useful 

4781 for updates that depend on each other to be built. 

4782 

4783 Attributes: 

4784 notes (str): A text field that holds arbitrary notes about the buildroot override. 

4785 submission_date (DateTime): The date that the buildroot override was submitted. 

4786 expiration_date (DateTime): The date that the buildroot override expires. 

4787 expired_date (DateTime): The date that the buildroot override expired. 

4788 build_id (int): The primary key of the :class:`Build` this override is related to. 

4789 build (Build): The build this override is related to. 

4790 submitter_id (int): The primary key of the :class:`User` this override was created by. 

4791 submitter (User): The user this override was created by. 

4792 """ 

4793 

4794 __tablename__ = 'buildroot_overrides' 

4795 __include_extras__ = ('nvr',) 

4796 __get_by__ = ('build_id',) 

4797 

4798 notes = Column(UnicodeText, nullable=False) 

4799 

4800 submission_date = Column(DateTime, default=datetime.utcnow, nullable=False) 

4801 expiration_date = Column(DateTime, nullable=False) 

4802 expired_date = Column(DateTime) 

4803 

4804 # Many-to-one relationships 

4805 build_id = Column(Integer, ForeignKey('builds.id'), nullable=False) 

4806 build = relationship('Build', lazy='joined', innerjoin=True, 

4807 backref=backref('override', uselist=False)) 

4808 

4809 submitter_id = Column(Integer, ForeignKey('users.id'), nullable=False) 

4810 submitter = relationship('User', lazy='joined', innerjoin=True, 

4811 backref='buildroot_overrides') 

4812 

4813 @property 

4814 def nvr(self) -> str: 

4815 """ 

4816 Return the NVR of the :class:`Build` associated with this override. 

4817 

4818 Returns: 

4819 The override's :class:`Build's <Build>` NVR. 

4820 """ 

4821 return self.build.nvr 

4822 

4823 @classmethod 

4824 def new(cls, request: 'pyramid.request', **data) -> 'BuildrootOverride': 

4825 """ 

4826 Create a new buildroot override. 

4827 

4828 Args: 

4829 request: The current web request. 

4830 data: A dictionary of all the attributes to be used on the new override. 

4831 Returns: 

4832 The newly created BuildrootOverride instance. 

4833 """ 

4834 db = request.db 

4835 

4836 build = data['build'] 

4837 

4838 if build.override is not None: 

4839 request.errors.add('body', 'nvr', 

4840 '%s is already in a override' % build.nvr) 

4841 return 

4842 

4843 old_build = db.query(Build).filter( 

4844 and_( 

4845 Build.package_id == build.package_id, 

4846 Build.release_id == build.release_id)).first() 

4847 

4848 if old_build is not None and old_build.override is not None: 

4849 # There already is a buildroot override for an older build of this 

4850 # package in this release. Expire it 

4851 log.debug(f"Expiring BRO for {old_build.nvr} because it's superseded by {build.nvr}.") 

4852 old_build.override.expire() 

4853 db.add(old_build.override) 

4854 

4855 override = cls(**data) 

4856 override.enable() 

4857 db.add(override) 

4858 db.flush() 

4859 

4860 return override 

4861 

4862 @classmethod 

4863 def edit(cls, request: 'pyramid.request', **data) -> 'BuildrootOverride': 

4864 """ 

4865 Edit an existing buildroot override. 

4866 

4867 Args: 

4868 request: The current web request. 

4869 data: The changed being made to the BuildrootOverride. 

4870 Returns: 

4871 The new updated override. 

4872 """ 

4873 db = request.db 

4874 edited = data.pop('edited') 

4875 override = cls.get(edited.id) 

4876 

4877 if override is None: 

4878 request.errors.add('body', 'edited', 

4879 'No buildroot override for this build') 

4880 return 

4881 

4882 override.submitter = data['submitter'] 

4883 override.notes = data['notes'] 

4884 override.expiration_date = data['expiration_date'] 

4885 if 'submission_date' in data: 

4886 override.submission_date = data['submission_date'] 

4887 

4888 now = datetime.utcnow() 

4889 

4890 if override.expired_date is not None and override.expiration_date > now: 

4891 # Buildroot override had expired, we need to unexpire it 

4892 override.enable() 

4893 

4894 elif data['expired']: 

4895 log.debug(f"Expiring BRO for {override.build.nvr} because it was edited.") 

4896 override.expire() 

4897 

4898 db.add(override) 

4899 db.flush() 

4900 

4901 return override 

4902 

4903 def enable(self) -> None: 

4904 """Mark the BuildrootOverride as enabled.""" 

4905 koji_session = buildsys.get_session() 

4906 koji_session.tagBuild(self.build.release.override_tag, self.build.nvr) 

4907 

4908 notifications.publish(override_schemas.BuildrootOverrideTagV1.from_dict( 

4909 dict(override=self))) 

4910 

4911 self.expired_date = None 

4912 

4913 def expire(self) -> None: 

4914 """Mark the BuildrootOverride as expired.""" 

4915 if self.expired_date is not None: 

4916 return 

4917 

4918 koji_session = buildsys.get_session() 

4919 try: 

4920 koji_session.untagBuild(self.build.release.override_tag, 

4921 self.build.nvr, strict=True) 

4922 except Exception as e: 

4923 log.error('Unable to untag override %s: %s' % (self.build.nvr, e)) 

4924 self.expired_date = datetime.utcnow() 

4925 

4926 notifications.publish(override_schemas.BuildrootOverrideUntagV1.from_dict( 

4927 {'override': self}))
